0.title: Paresh, Revathi to star in film adaptation of Ray's Golpo Bolo Tarini Khuro
0.article_body: Satyajit Ray's short story 'Golpo Bolo Tarini Khuro' is being adapted into a film. Titled 'The Storyteller', the film will star Paresh Rawal, Adil Hussain, Revathi and Tannishtha Chatterjee. Ananth Narayan Mahadevan, who will direct 'The Storyteller', said that the team is "happy and honoured" to introduce the master storyteller to the younger generation with the upcoming film.

1.title: Pak govt says will hold polls in August 2023, not before: Report
1.article_body: The Pakistani government led by PM Shehbaz Sharif has rejected his predecessor Imran Khan's demand to hold elections early, according to a report quoting sources. The ruling PML-N reportedly said the elections would be held in August 2023, after the completion of the ongoing term. Notably, Khan is planning a protest march to Islamabad seeking dissolution of the National Assembly.

2.title: FB selfie helps B'luru police to arrest murder accused after 5 yrs
2.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have arrested a 35-year-old murder accused, Madhusoodhan alias Madhu, who was on the run for five years. According to police, Madhu's friend had recently posted a selfie of them on Facebook, which led to his arrest. Madhu and his associates allegedly killed a retired bank manager to rob a diamond necklace worth crores in 2014.

3.title: Brought tears: Kejriwal after Mann dismisses Punjab Health Minister
3.article_body: After Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann dismissed state Health Minister Vijay Singla following corruption charges against him, Delhi CM and AAP founder Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "Proud of you Bhagwant. Your action has brought tears to my eyes." Singla was demanding a 1% commission from officials for contracts, Punjab CM's Office said. Singla was later arrested by the state's Anti-Corruption Branch.

4.title: Pawan Kalyan, ex-wife attend son Akira's high school graduation, share post
4.article_body: Actor Pawan Kalyan and his ex-wife Renu Desai attended their 18-year-old son Akira Nandan’s high school graduation ceremony. On Monday, Renu and Pawan shared a family photo featuring  Akira. Alongside the post, Renu wrote, "An era ends and an era begins. Proud parents of an amazing boy on his graduation day...I have told Akira that his true journey begins now."

5.title: Had pre-jitters; Cannes is big, you pray you don't fall, step on dress: Nargis
5.article_body: Actress Nargis Fakhri said that she had jitters before walking the red carpet at Cannes. "I was a little stressed about walking the red carpet as walking for Cannes is a big thing. You want everything to work out. You are praying that you don't fall or step on your dress or that any mishaps happen," she added.

6.title: Too bad, I'm never letting you go: Farah shares pic with Shirish on his b'day
6.article_body: Farah Khan Kunder took to Instagram on Tuesday to wish her filmmaker-husband Shirish Kunder on his 49th birthday. Sharing a few pictures, she wrote, "Too bad, I'm never letting you go...Happy birthday Shirish (pics 2&3 will explain why)." The first picture features Farah and Shirish, while the second and third pictures feature Shirish with his kids, Czar, Diva and Anya.

7.title: Exams of non-agriculture universities in Maha to be held offline: Minister
7.article_body: The examinations of non-agriculture universities in Maharashtra will be held offline, said state Higher and Technical Education Minister Uday Samant on Tuesday. "If we keep conducting the exams online, it would raise a question mark on whether the industry would accept such students," Samant said, adding that the decision has been taken by vice-chancellors of 13 non-agricultural universities.

8.title: Bengaluru civic body begins training doctors on treating monkeypox
8.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has started imparting training to doctors on treating monkeypox. As per reports, healthcare workers are being trained to look for symptoms of the viral disease. Besides this, the daily testing for COVID-19 will be scaled up from 11,000 to 15,000, according to BBMP Special Commissioner (Administration) S Rangappa.

9.title: UP teacher submits fake graduation marksheet to get job, booked
9.article_body: A teacher of an inter-college in UP’s Muzaffarnagar has been booked for allegedly submitting a fake document in order to get a job, police said. He was posted as an assistant teacher at Arvind Inter College in Muzaffarnagar district, police added. His graduation marksheet was found to be fake, following which an FIR was lodged on Monday.

10.title: Kangana trolled over failure of 'Dhaakad', Richa says 'People are expressing dissent'
10.article_body: Richa Chadha said those trolling Kangana Ranaut on the failure of 'Dhaakad' are "expressing dissent in whatever way they can". She was replying to tweets by Tehseen Poonawalla, wherein he criticised trolls "celebrating" its failure. However, Richa also wrote that it's "morally wrong because thousands of people work on a film", while adding, "But also, it happens. And to everyone."

11.title: India's 1st  self-driving cars startup Minus Zero raises $1.7 million in funding
11.article_body: India's first startup building affordable fully self-driving cars, Minus Zero, has raised $1.7 million in a seed round led by Chiratae Ventures with participation from JITO Angel Network and senior executives from American chipmaker NVIDIA and US-based ride-hailing service Lyft. The startup was founded by Gagandeep Reehal and Gursimran Kalra in 2021 while they were still students.

12.title: Sri Lanka seeks $500 million loan from India for purchase of petroleum products
12.article_body: Sri Lanka is seeking a $500-million loan from the Export-Import Bank of India (India Exim Bank) to purchase petroleum products amid severe economic crisis. Sri Lanka on Tuesday raised petrol and diesel prices by record 24.3% and 38.4%, respectively. On Monday, India delivered around 40,000 metric tonnes of petrol to Sri Lanka, days after supplying 40,000 metric tonnes of diesel.

13.title: Anything related to sex still remains to be a taboo in society: Ram Gopal Varma
13.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said he was disappointed when some theatres refused to screen his lesbian film 'Khatra'. He added, "Anything related to sex still remains to be a taboo [in society]." "Even today, despite the Supreme Court repealing section 377, nearly four and a half years back, I don't think people are willing to talk about it," Varma said.

14.title: Playing in India, where my parents were born, is great opportunity: Alana King
14.article_body: Australian spinner Alana King, who is currently playing for Supernovas in the Women's T20 Challenge said playing in India is a "great opportunity" for her. "To play in a country where my parents were born and raised is absolutely a great opportunity for me. I could not say no to this," said King after winning against the Trailblazers on Monday.

15.title: Meta's Zuckerberg sued over Cambridge Analytica privacy breach
15.article_body: Meta's billionaire CEO Mark Zuckerberg has been sued by the District of Columbia over the Cambridge Analytica scandal, a privacy breach of millions of Facebook users' personal data. The lawsuit seeks to hold Zuckerberg personally liable for the breach, maintaining that he directly participated in important company decisions and that he was aware of potential dangers of sharing users' data.

16.title: Pune youth arrested over contact with terror operatives in J&K
16.article_body: Pune unit of the Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) on Tuesday arrested a man, in his early 20s, from the Dapodi area for his alleged contact with terror operatives from Jammu and Kashmir. The accused, identified as Junaid Mohammed, was connected with them through phone messenger groups, officers said. He had also received ₹10,000 for terror-related activities from them, officers added.

17.title: Virtue of subsidy only if it's swift & for short run: Piyush Goyal
17.article_body: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal, during a panel at the World Economic Forum in Davos, said the "virtue of subsidy is only when it's swift and in the short run". "Our approach isn't going to be driven by subsidies...It's going to be...focused on structural reform and ease of doing business," he stated while urging Indian businesses to be "more proactive".

18.title: My mother once cried seeing my bruised face, said no one would marry me: Boxer Nikhat
18.article_body: World champion boxer Nikhat Zareen has revealed that her mother started shivering and crying after seeing her bruised face following her first sparring session. Nikhat added that her mother then told her that no one would marry her. "I replied, 'Don’t worry, once I make a name for myself, grooms will queue up at the doorstep'," Nikhat stated.

19.title: 'If you fall asleep, it's ok', says Biden jokingly to new Australia PM at Quad meet
19.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday welcomed newly-elected Australia PM Anthony Albanese to his first Quad meeting and praised him for making the long journey to Japan, right after being sworn in. Biden told Albanese, "You were sworn in and got on a plane...if you fall asleep while you're here, it's okay, because I don't know how you're doing it."

20.title: Mumbai Police shares 'Panchayat 2' meme asking people to avoid triple ride
20.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police shared a meme on its Twitter handle using 'Panchayat' season 2 dialogue asking people to avoid riding triple seat. In its post, the Mumbai Police shared the reaction of a 'Responsible Citizen' when their friends ask them to go for a ride triple seat and quoted the dialogue, "Ye sab mein comfortable nahi hun mai."

21.title: I kill criminals, not children & elders like Putin: Philippine Prez
21.article_body: Outgoing Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte criticised Russian President Vladimir Putin over the deaths of civilians in Ukraine. "Many say that Putin and I are both killers...But I kill criminals, I don't kill children and...elderly," Duterte said. This is the first time that Duterte, who calls Putin an idol and a friend, voiced his rebuke over Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

22.title: TRAI's KYC-based caller ID plan won't be a competitor: Truecaller
22.article_body: Truecaller CEO Alan Mamedi in response to the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) planning to develop a KYC-based caller ID system said, "We do not see that this would be a competitive service comparable to the full range of services and functionality that Truecaller offers." The proposed service could be a "driving catalyst" for the company's growth, he added.

23.title: Goods worth lakhs of rupees destroyed after fire at Noida building
23.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a commercial building in Noida on Monday, destroying goods worth several lakhs of rupees, police said. Over 10 shops in the complex caught fire, which took around three hours to be doused, said Arun Kumar Singh, Chief Fire Officer of Gautam Buddha Nagar district. However, no casualties have been reported in the incident.

24.title: Ghaziabad civic body seeks ₹491 cr in pending funds from state govt
24.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation is seeking ₹491 crore in pending funds from the state government as it seeks to carry out developmental work. Officials said that dues are pending on account of infrastructure development funds, which the civic body earns when residents take up sale deeds and pay stamp duties. The civic body is in dire need of funds, councillors said.

25.title: Heritage block at Hyd's Osmania Hospital won't be demolished: Owaisi
25.article_body: The century-old Osmania General Hospital's heritage block will be protected by the Telangana government while building new infrastructure. Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi said, "The hospital's heritage building won't be demolished but restored." He added that a new building will also be constructed while not obstructing the view of the heritage building and it is likely to cost nearly ₹560 crore.

26.title: Mental health report must before giving death sentence: Supreme Court
26.article_body: Supreme Court has ruled that all courts will now be required to call for an accused's mental health report and monitor their behaviour in jail before giving a death sentence. This will establish the person's frame of mind at the time of the crime, it added. SC was hearing an appeal made by three death row convicts from Madhya Pradesh.

27.title: Private tutor arrested from UP for kidnapping Thane girl student
27.article_body: A 35-year-old private tutor has been arrested from his residence in Uttar Pradesh for abducting his 13-year-old girl student from Thane. The accused was traced using Global Positioning System (GPS) 20 days after the girl went missing. The accused told police that he had kidnapped the girl by seducing her and convincing her that he loved her.

28.title: US oil price drops below $110 mark on global recession fears
28.article_body: US oil price fell below the $110 mark on Tuesday amid fears of a possible global recession and China's COVID-19 curbs affecting supply. While US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell 72 cents to $109.57/barrel, Brent crude fell 56 cents to $112.86/barrel. Price of Brent crude earlier hit $139/barrel in March this year, its highest since 2008.

29.title: 24-year-old missing Delhi engineer found dead in Lonavala forest
29.article_body: Pune police said on Tuesday that body of 24-year-old Delhi engineer, Farhan Serajuddin, who went missing in Lonavala forest near Pune on May 20, has been traced. Authorities, including NDRF, were coordinating operations to retrieve his body. Farhan, who had gone to Lonavala for trekking, had contacted his family to inform them that he lost his way before becoming untraceable.

30.title: Nawazuddin gets Excellence in Cinema Award at French Riviera fest
30.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui received the Excellence in Cinema Award at the French Riviera Film Festival. He received the honour from two-time Emmy award-winning actor Vincent De Paul. Sharing pictures on social media, Nawazuddin wrote, "Receiving the [award] made the wonderful evening...more special. Memorable time spent with the amazing Cinema Artists from across the Globe was a beautiful feeling."

31.title: No verdict on Gyanvapi Mosque case today, Muslim petitioners to be heard on May 26
31.article_body: The Varanasi district court, hearing the arguments on a civil suit on the Gyanvapi mosque-Kashi Viswanath temple complex dispute, on Tuesday said it will hear the Muslim side that has sought to reject Hindus' civil suit seeking claim on the mosque. The next hearing is scheduled for May 26 (Thursday). The court did not give any verdict on Tuesday.

32.title: Didn't like 'Dil...' song, asked director 'How will one dance on this': Farah
32.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan said that she did not like the title track of 'Dil Bechara'. "I asked Mukesh [director], 'How will one dance on this?'. He reasoned, 'No, everyone has liked this song'...I was like, 'Let me do it in one shot. So in just one day, we'll complete the song shoot and I'll be free'," she added.

33.title: Tom Cruise 9 years older than me but looks younger: Jon Hamm
33.article_body: Actor Jon Hamm said that his 'Top Gun: Maverick' co-star Tom Cruise looks younger than him, adding that he doesn't know how that works. Tom, who is 59-years-old, is nine years older than Jon. Jon added that he was 15 when he first saw the film's prequel 'Top Gun', adding that he left the "heavy lifting" to the younger generation.

34.title: Agent says Heard kept 'Aquaman 2' role due to Jason Momoa: Report
34.article_body: Agent Kathryn Arnold testified in the ongoing defamation trial against Amber Heard filed by Johnny Depp. She stated Heard kept her "radically reduced" 'Aquaman 2' role because co-star Jason Momoa and director James Wan were "adamant she was in the film", reported Daily Mail. Kathryn reportedly said Momoa renegotiated his fee to $15 million but Heard was paid $2 million.

35.title: Rainfall, thundersquall predicted in several states; IMD releases list
35.article_body: IMD has predicted rainfall over J&K, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Haryana, UP, Rajasthan and MP today and tomorrow. It also predicted heavy rainfall over Odisha today and over Assam and Meghalaya on May 27 and 28 and widespread rain over Kerala and Puducherry for next five days. Thundersquall is predicted over Uttarakhand, Jharkhand, West Bengal and Odisha today.

36.title: OYO planning to launch $7-8 billion IPO after September: Report
36.article_body: OYO is planning to launch its IPO after September and has written to SEBI, seeking to file updated and restated consolidated financial information, PTI reported. The firm, which had earlier planned to raise $11 billion, is now reportedly prepared to settle for a lower valuation of $7-8 billion. OYO had last raised $5 million from Microsoft in August 2021.

37.title: Overcharged for water consumption by landlord, Nagpur couple dies by suicide
37.article_body: A couple allegedly died by suicide in Nagpur after being reportedly overcharged for water consumption by their landlord, police said on Monday.  The 45-year-old deceased who worked as a used vehicle dealer and his 40-year-old wife were the residents of Gauri Nagar in the Kalamna area of the city. Further investigation into the matter is underway, police said.

38.title: 4 dead, 5 injured as bus collides with truck in Rajasthan's Kota
38.article_body: A bus collided with a truck in Rajasthan's Kota leaving four passengers of the bus dead while five got injured. The deceased were identified as Virendra, Narayan, Jitendra Singh and Jitu. The driver of the bus, which had around 50 passengers, lost control after he stuck his neck out of the window to spit tobacco, police said.

39.title: Telangana Cong MLA criticises TRS on latter's RS candidate choice
39.article_body: Telangana Congress Working President Jagga Reddy has criticised the TRS government for reportedly nominating industrialist Bandi Parthasaradhi Reddy to the Rajya Sabha. "How can a person who committed a major scam is given a Rajya Sabha seat," asked Jagga. The Congress MLA further accused Parthasaradhi of indulging in the alleged Remdesivir medicine scam during the pandemic in the state.

40.title: Depp's ex-girlfriend Kate Moss to testify after Amber's 'stairs' remark: Report
40.article_body: Johnny Depp's ex-girlfriend Kate Moss will reportedly be testifying in the actor's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. This comes after Amber had mentioned Moss being allegedly pushed down the stairs by Depp during her testimony. As per People magazine, Moss will testify in court via video link on Wednesday.  Moss and Depp dated in the 1990s.

41.title: If 2 co-stars go for coffee, it's reported they were 'spotted' together: Kartik
41.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said if two actors who are working together go out for coffee, it will be reported that they were "spotted" together. "People will begin to talk...Shall I stop going out? Or shall I look for secret spots? What if two people are meeting...just as friends? If four people go out...they'll publish photos of just two," he added.

42.title: Delhi to install AEDs in public places to prevent cardiac arrest deaths
42.article_body: Delhi government is planning to install automated external defibrillators (AEDs) in public places to ensure quick medical attention to people experiencing sudden cardiac arrests. AED is a medical device designed to analyse the heart rhythm and restore it to normal via controlled electric shocks. Officials said a mapping exercise would begin to identify possible locations in Delhi to install AEDs.

43.title: Hope UN rights chief's Xinjiang visit will clarify misinformation: China
43.article_body: Ahead of UN High Commissioner for Human Rights chief's visit to Xinjiang region, China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi said he hoped that Michelle Bachelet's visit would help "clarify misinformation". Beijing has been accused of unlawful treatment and forced labour of Uighurs and other Muslim minorities in Xinjiang. She's expected to visit Xinjiang's Urumqi and Kashgar cities on Tuesday and Wednesday.

44.title: Johnny Depp's severed finger story has flaws, claims hand surgeon
44.article_body: A hand surgeon testified Johnny Depp couldn't have lost his finger tip the way he said it happened. Surgeon Richard Moore, called by Amber Heard's team, said Depp described his palm was down on a bar when it was struck by bottle. Moore, who didn't treat Depp, said Depp's description is unlikely, in large part because his fingernail remained intact.

45.title: Putin survived assassination attempt 2 months ago: Ukraine spy chief
45.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin was attacked in an attempt to be killed around two months ago, shortly after the start of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the Chief of Defence Intelligence of Ukraine has said. The attempt on Putin's life was made in the Caucasus region, Kyrylo Budanov said. He called the attempt "absolutely unsuccessful".

46.title: Rahul Dravid took the call to not include Dhawan in India's T20I squad: Reports
46.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid took the call to not include Shikhar Dhawan in T20I squad for the series against South Africa, reports stated quoting a senior BCCI official. "In T20Is, you've to give chances to youngsters who have been doing well. We all agreed [with Rahul's decision]. Shikhar was informed by Rahul before the team announcement," the official stated.

47.title: Klarna doesn't exist in a bubble: CEO after firing 10% of startup's workforce
47.article_body: Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski told employees the Swedish fintech startup "doesn't exist in a bubble" as he announced plans to fire about 10% of its global workforce. "When we set our business plans for 2022...it was a very different world," he wrote. "Since then, we've seen a tragic...war in Ukraine unfold...increase in inflation, a highly volatile stock market," Siemiatkowski added.

48.title: India looking to limit sugar exports, say reports; sugar companies' shares plunge
48.article_body: Shares of sugar companies plunged on Tuesday after reports said that Indian government is looking to limit sugar exports for the first time in six years to prevent a surge in domestic prices. Reuters reported the government could cap this season's exports at 10 million tonnes. India is the world's biggest sugar producer and the second biggest exporter behind Brazil.

49.title: Sonia Gandhi forms new groups, task force for 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
49.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi has formed a 'Political Affairs Group' that will be presided by her, a 'Task Force-2024' and a 'Central Planning Group' for the coordination of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "Each member of the task force shall be assigned specific tasks related to organisation, communications and media, outreach, finance and election management," said the party.

50.title: 1,000 kg meat bought for wedding biryani seized due to bad quality in TN
50.article_body: The Food Safety Department in Tamil Nadu has seized 800 kg of spoiled mutton and 200 kg of chicken bought by a restaurant to prepare biryani for a wedding party in Tiruvarur. The caterers experienced a foul smell and the meat didn't cook properly. A food safety officer said the samples will be sent to a laboratory for testing.

51.title: Police to penalise people for storing bricks on rooftops in Bihar's Champaran
51.article_body: In order to prevent incidents of stone pelting, the West Champaran police in Bihar has decided to penalise people for storing bricks or stones on the rooftop of their houses. "We'll conduct aerial survey of the district. If bricks or stones are found on a rooftop...notice will immediately be served to...owner of the house seeking explanation," said SHO Rakesh Bhaskar.

52.title: Akshay Kumar recovers from COVID-19, resumes 'Prithviraj' promotions
52.article_body: Akshay Kumar, who was diagnosed with COVID-19 recently, has recovered from the virus. The actor has also resumed promotions for his film 'Prithviraj'. Akshay had shared the news of his diagnosis on May 14, saying, "Was really looking forward to rooting for our cinema at the India Pavilion at #Cannes2022, but have sadly tested positive for COVID."

53.title: India needs clear regulation for crypto investments: Binance exec
53.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance APAC Head Leon Foong in an interview discussing cryptocurrency investments in India said, "A clear, progressive, and pro-innovation regulatory framework is necessary in giving investors comfort and certainty that India is the right place to be putting their money." He added blockchain startups are what brought the attention of Binance and many investors in India.

54.title: Temple's character can't change with demolition: BJP leader
54.article_body: Amid the ongoing Gyanvapi mosque case, BJP leader and lawyer Ashwini Upadhyay said that a temple's religious character does not change after the demolition of roof, walls, pillars, foundation and even offering namaz. "After the 'pran pratishtha' of idol, a temple always remains a temple until the idol is shifted to another temple with the rituals of 'visharjan'," he added.

55.title: Cancel water theft FIRs against 32 farmers: SAD chief to Punjab CM
55.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal has asked Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to order the cancellation of water theft FIRs immediately that have been registered against 32 farmers in Fazilka. The irrigation department officials, who were "failing" in their duty to provide requisite water to farmers of the state, were "victimising" them, Badal said.

56.title: Dismissed Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla arrested on corruption charges
56.article_body: Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla was on Tuesday arrested by the state's Anti-Corruption Branch following complaints of corruption against him. This comes after Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann dismissed Singla from the state Cabinet after receiving "concrete evidence" against him. Singla was allegedly demanding 1% commission from officials for contracts, according to the Chief Minister's Office.

57.title: Hindu deities used in building Qutub Minar complex but can't revive worship there: ASI
57.article_body: The Archaeological Survey of India has told a Delhi court that though it is a fact that architectural images of Hindu and Jain deities were used in the construction of the Qutub Minar complex, revival of worship cannot be allowed. "Revival of worship is not allowed wherever it's not practiced at the time of protection of a monument," it said.

58.title: 20-yr-old man enters 43-yr-old TN woman's house, rapes her at knifepoint
58.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping a 43-year-old woman at knifepoint after stalking her for two days in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. Police said the incident took place on May 20. The man, who was following the woman all day, forcefully barged into her house when she returned from office. He sealed her mouth and raped her, police said.

59.title: 273 cylinders seized as police bust LPG refilling racket in Pune
59.article_body: Pune Rural Police have arrested four people as they busted a liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) refilling racket on Monday. The police also recovered 273 cylinders which were stored illegally and unsafely in Shirur. The arrests were made after the police received a tip-off about the racket, which was being run from a makeshift facility built on a farm.

60.title: I'm crazy about Indian food, I love it to pieces: Jurassic Park actor Goldblum
60.article_body: Hollywood actor Jeff Goldblum, known for starring in films like 'Jurassic Park', 'The Grand Budapest Hotel' and 'Independence Day', has said he's "crazy about Indian food". "I love it to pieces," he added. "I eat too much of it when I have it because it is the most delicious food, I think, on Earth," Goldblum further said.

61.title: Du Plessis' powerplay strike rate is 104, it puts pressure on Kohli: Hogg
61.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said RCB captain Faf Du Plessis has a strike rate of 104 while batting in powerplay, adding that it puts pressure on Virat Kohli. "Kohli...is not at his best yet," stated Hogg. Talking about LSG captain KL Rahul, Hogg said Rahul's strike rate in powerplay isn't good enough and puts too much pressure on remaining batters.

62.title: I will definitely be with RCB next year, don't know in which capacity yet: AB de Villiers
62.article_body: Former South Africa and RCB wicketkeeper-batter AB de Villiers has said that he will definitely be around the IPL next year. "I will be [with] RCB next year...don't know in which capacity yet," he added. He further said, "I would love to return to my second home (Bengaluru) and I am looking forward to it."

63.title: Swedish fintech startup Klarna lays off 10% staff via prerecorded video message
63.article_body: Swedish fintech startup Klarna on Monday announced that it will lay off 10% of its 7,000 employees. In a prerecorded video message to the employees, CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski cited the Ukraine war, inflation, "shift in consumer sentiment" and a "highly volatile market" as the reason for layoffs. He added that employees in Europe will receive an "associated compensation".

64.title: 6 of family killed as lorry collides with mini-truck in Haryana's Jind
64.article_body: At least six members of a family and 17 others were injured after a lorry collided head-on with a mini-truck in which they were travelling in Haryana's Jind, police said. As many as 23 persons from the family in Hisar's Narnaund had gone to Haridwar to perform certain religious rites after the death of a family member, police added.

65.title: Confidence of opposition rises immensely on knowing they'll face RCB: Sehwag
65.article_body: Talking about RCB being knocked out in the Eliminator stage of IPL 2020 and IPL 2021, Virender Sehwag said, "The opposition's self confidence increases immensely when they come to know that they are playing RCB." "RCB try their best," added Sehwag. Sehwag jokingly stated that ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel didn't want RCB to qualify for the playoffs of IPL 2022.

66.title: Starlink will serve everywhere on Earth we're legally allowed: Musk
66.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in response to a Twitter user asking about Starlink's plans for Africa, said, "Starlink will serve everywhere on Earth that we're legally allowed to serve." The user had asked Musk if he had any plans for Starlink's entry to Africa, to which Musk replied, "Yes, first countries in Africa to be announced coming soon."

67.title: Iron shed collapses on workers as crane lifts it in Guj; 3 dead
67.article_body: Three workers were killed and four others critically injured after an iron shed at a rice mill factory in Gujarat's Ahmedabad collapsed on Monday. The incident occurred around 7 pm. The iron shed collapsed on the workers while it was being lifted by a crane, according to the police. The injured workers were taken to a hospital, an inspector said.

68.title: Qatar WC expected to be watched by 5 billion people: FIFA Prez
68.article_body: FIFA President Gianni Infantino has claimed that a global audience of 5 billion is expected to watch this year's football World Cup. "The last women's FIFA World Cup was watched by 1.2 billion people. This World Cup in Qatar will be watched by 5 billion people...way above half of the world's population," Infantino said.

69.title: Plea seeks FIR against Akhilesh, Owaisi for 'hurting religious sentiments'
69.article_body: A plea has been filed against AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav for allegedly "hurting religious sentiments" in name of the Gyanvapi Mosque case and the Kashi Vishwanath temple. Advocate Hari Shankar Pandey filed a petition in the Varanasi court seeking directions to the police to register FIR against seven people, including Yadav, Owaisi and his brother.

70.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal flags off 150 new electric AC buses
70.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal flagged off 150 new AC electric buses today and said, "Please take care of them, don't make them dirty." "We launched 150 buses today, 150 more would be added next month. We aim to launch over 2,000 such buses within a year. Over next 10 years, ₹1,862 crore to be spent by Delhi government," Kejriwal said.

71.title: PIL in HC over equal status for 'Vande Mataram', 'Jana Gana Mana'
71.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) has been filed in Delhi High Court seeking a declaration that the poem 'Vande Mataram' will be "honoured equally" to the national anthem 'Jana Gana Mana'. The poem is a "symbol of our history, sovereignty, unity and pride", it said. If a citizen disrespects the poem, it'll "spell doom to all our rights", it added.

72.title: Employee among 3 arrested for burglary at jewellery shop in Bengaluru
72.article_body: The Bengaluru Police on Monday arrested three people for stealing 8 kg of silver articles from a jewellery shop in Chamarajpete. According to police, one of the accused, identified as Rahul, worked at the shop. Rahul had opened two apparel shops in the city and incurred losses. He thus formulated a plan to steal from his employer's shop, police said.

73.title: Egyptian media tycoon jailed for sexually assaulting 7 orphan girls
73.article_body: An Egyptian court has sentenced businessman Mohamed el-Amin to three years in prison for sexually assaulting seven minor girls in an orphanage he founded. He has also been ordered to pay a fine of 200,000 Egyptian pounds (about $11,000). The tycoon, who founded several Egyptian media outlets, was arrested in January after allegations of sexual abuse at the orphanage surfaced.

74.title: Kerala becoming erstwhile Kashmir: BJP on provocative slogans at PFI rally
74.article_body: After a video of a minor boy raising provocative slogans during the Popular Front of India (PFI) rally in Kerala went viral, BJP spokesperson Tom Vadakkan said, "[It] sounds very familiar to what we have heard numerous times in Kashmir...from...'tukde tukde' gang and at...demonstrations which were anti-national." "Kerala is moving towards becoming the erstwhile Kashmir," he added.

75.title: Rohit Shetty runs with 27 kg camera while filming 'Indian...', shares video
75.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty took to Instagram to share a video from set of 'Indian Police Force'. In the video, Rohit can be seen running with a camera, which he mentioned was 27 kg, while actor Sidharth Malhotra can be seen performing an action sequence. "It's weird how glass breaks...body hits...and staircase falls are normal for us!" Rohit wrote on Instagram.

76.title: I'm Hindu, will eat beef if I want to: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
76.article_body: Congress' Siddaramaiah said that he is a Hindu who had not consumed beef till now, but he would eat beef if he wanted to. "Beef eaters don't belong to just one community, even Hindus consume beef, Christians consume it as well...I have even said it in Karnataka Assembly. Who are you to tell me to not consume beef?" Siddaramaiah said.

77.title: EV cab platform BluSmart raises $25 mn in extended Series A round
77.article_body: Electric ride-hailing platform ﻿BluSmart﻿ has raised $25 million in an extended Series A round. The funding in the Series A1 round includes $15 million in equity capital, led by BP Ventures and Green Frontier Capital, and venture debt of $10 million. The venture debt funding came from Stride Ventures, Alteria Capital, BlackSoil and UCIC.

78.title: AAP dissolves its Goa working committee, says will reorganise
78.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) dissolved its Goa working committee on Monday, months after the conclusion of the Assembly elections. The party's state incharge Atishi said that the new committee will be reorganised soon. "With expansion of the party in mind…we will constitute a new committee to bring well-meaning and like-minded people into the party's fold," she said.

79.title: 22-year-old man robbed, murdered in Gurugram's IMT Manesar
79.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly murdered and dumped in the IMT Manesar area in Gurugram, police said. The incident took place when the victim was returning home after closing his shop in Aliar village. "The victim's phone was robbed. He suffered injuries on his face, back of the head, arms and back- all inflicted by a sharp object," police added.

80.title: Punjab CM dismisses state Health Minister Vijay Singla on charges of corruption
80.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has dismissed state Health Minister Vijay Singla following complaints of corruption against him. The Chief Minister's Office said Singla was demanding 1% commission from officials for contracts. Punjab CMO also said that concrete evidence has been found against him. AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal had earlier asked public to record incident if someone asked for bribe.

81.title: Scientists in US start trial on vaccine that prevents pancreatic cancer
81.article_body: US scientists have started a vaccine trial that could prevent pancreatic cancer. Accordingly, a woman with family history of the disease has been given the first jab. Researchers hope the vaccine would equip her body with tools to identify rogue cells that may become cancerous and enable her immune system to launch search and destroy missions to prevent the disease.

82.title: Husband gets 10 years in jail in Kerala student's dowry death case
82.article_body: A Kollam court has sentenced S Kiran Kumar, the husband of Ayurveda medical student Vismaya V Nair who died by suicide in her marital home last year, to 10 years in jail. The court on Monday found him guilty of dowry death and abetting her suicide. Vismaya was 22 years old when she died by suicide on June 21, 2021.

83.title: Ram Gopal Varma booked for cheating a production house of ₹56 lakh
83.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma has been booked by police in Hyderabad for allegedly cheating a production house to the tune of ₹56 lakh. This comes after Koppada Sekhar Raju of Sekhara Art Creations lodged a complaint alleging that Varma borrowed money for producing a movie titled 'Disha' with a promise to return the amount before its release but didn't repay.

84.title: Snap to slow down hiring, expects to miss quarterly revenue target
84.article_body: Snap CEO Evan Spiegel has told his employees that the company would significantly slow down hiring for the rest of the year and it may miss its revenue goals for the quarter. Spiegel wrote, "Like many companies, we continue to face rising inflation and interest rates, supply chain shortages and labour disruptions,...the impact of the war in Ukraine, and more."

85.title: Death toll due to Assam floods, landslides rises to 25: ASDMA
85.article_body: As many as 25 people have lost their lives so far due to floods and landslides across the state, Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) said. Over 6.5 lakh people remained affected by the floods across 22 districts, it added. As many as 1,709 villages are under water and 82,503 hectares of crop areas have been damaged, ASDMA stated.

86.title: Justin Bieber to return to India after 5 yrs; will perform in Delhi on Oct 18
86.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber is all set to visit India again. He will be performing at Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium on October 18 this year. The singer will be visiting India as a part of the world tour that he is doing to promote his latest album 'Justice'. Tickets for the concert will be available on BookMyShow beginning June 4.

87.title: Ex-world no.1 Naomi Osaka knocked out of French Open 2022 in first round
87.article_body: Ex-world number one Naomi Osaka was knocked out in the women's singles first round of French Open 2022 after losing 5-7, 4-6 against Amanda Anisimova. Osaka was playing only her second match on clay this season. Roland Garros 2016 champion Garbiñe Muguruza was earlier knocked out in the first round after being defeated 6-2, 3-6, 4-6 by Kaia Kanepi.

88.title: Construction of Ram Mandir in Ayodhya is in full swing: Temple Trust
88.article_body: Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra (SRJBTK) on Monday said that Ram Mandir's construction in Ayodhya is in full swing. While the foundation has been laid, the plinth raising work is still going on, SRJBTK added. "The plinth is raised using granite stone blocks from Karnataka and Telangana. The installation of carved sandstones around the sanctum sanctorum will...commence soon," it said.

89.title: Over 100 activists of Imran Khan's party arrested in Pakistan
89.article_body: Over 100 activists of former PM Imran Khan's party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf have been reportedly arrested ahead of a planned march to capital Islamabad. The PTI supporters are seeking early elections in the country. The police is said to have acted on the instructions of the ruling PML-N coalition. Most of the arrests were made in Lahore, said a PTI official.

90.title: 2 inter-state gang members arrested for ₹18 lakh bank robbery in Mohali
90.article_body: An inter-state gang of bank robbers was busted by Mohali police and two of its members were arrested who are allegedly involved in ₹18 lakh robbery in Gharuan village. The robbery took place on May 5 at Co-operative Bank’s branch. "This is an inter-state gang which already carried out several bank theft incidents in different states," a police official said.

91.title: 1 person in custody over boy's hate slogans at PFI rally in Kerala
91.article_body: Kerala Police have taken one person into custody during an investigation into a viral video of a minor boy raising provocative slogans allegedly at a Popular Front of India (PFI) rally in Alappuzha. Cases have also been registered against the PFI district president, secretary and other persons. The purported video shows the boy sitting on the shoulders of a person.

92.title: West Bengal cabinet approves to recruit 2,020 women police constables
92.article_body: The West Bengal cabinet on Monday approved to recruit 2,020 women police constables to strengthen the law and order. Out of these, 1,420 constables will be recruited for the 'Winners' squad to check crimes against women, CM Mamata Banerjee said. Besides, 105 special home guards will be appointed in Jangalmahal, a forested region known for Maoist activities earlier, Banerjee added.

93.title: Gene-edited tomatoes could be a new source of vitamin D: Study
93.article_body: Tomatoes could be gene-edited to produce vitamin D that can help reduce deficiency across the world, a study stated. Using gene-editing technique, researchers turned off a specific molecule in the plant's genome that increased provitamin D3 production in both the fruit and leaves of tomato plants. When exposed to UV light, this precursor, provitamin D3, was converted to vitamin D3.

94.title: US President Biden praised PM Modi for his handling of pandemic, criticised China: Report
94.article_body: US President Joe Biden praised PM Narendra Modi for his handling of COVID-19 pandemic and contrasted India's success with China's failure, though both countries are of comparable size, ANI reported quoting an official. He added PM Modi's success showed that democracies can deliver and busted the myth that autocracies like China and Russia can handle the rapidly changing world better.

95.title: Taiwan & Ukraine issue different, absurd to compare them: China to Biden
95.article_body: After US President Joe Biden compared China's military threat to self-ruled Taiwan to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Wang Wenbin said, "Taiwan...and...Ukraine issues are fundamentally different. To compare those two is absurd." "Taiwan is an inalienable part of the Chinese territory," he added. Biden had said US would defend Taiwan militarily if China invaded it.

96.title: Every time it would play, everybody would start crying: Farah on 'Sandese...’
96.article_body: Choreographer-filmmaker Farah Khan who choreographed the song 'Sandese Aate Hai' from film 'Border' said everybody would start crying every time the song was played, as it was so emotional. "The soldiers, the actors and...I would start crying," added Farah. Farah stated that doing the choreography was very tough, adding she used to be in a different state while shooting it.

97.title: 5 of family on way to Kedarnath killed in road crash in western UP
97.article_body: Five members of a family, including two children, died after their speeding car rammed into a stationary truck on the Bulandshahr-Meerut highway on Tuesday morning. "There were around 10 people of the family inside the Mahindra Scorpio and on way to...Kedarnath shrine," said District Magistrate Chandra Prakash Singh. The other six people suffered injuries in the accident, Singh added.

98.title: Actress Chhavi undergoes radiotherapy after cancer surgery, shares pic of bandaged belly
98.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal took to Instagram to share a picture of her bandaged belly after undergoing radiotherapy following her breast cancer surgery. "These beautiful markings you see on my body are to ensure that the radiotherapy is directed towards the correct areas only. I have to keep these till the radiotherapy lasts (1 month)," she wrote.

99.title: We suspect they planned it for months, watched videos: Police on Delhi triple suicide
99.article_body: Police said that they suspect that the three women, who were found dead in their house in Delhi's Vasant Vihar, had been planning the move for months. "The search history on the mobile phones indicates [this]. They also watched videos on YouTube...Their phones have been sent for further examination," Police said, adding that some suicide notes run into multiple pages.

100.title: Tehseen criticises people 'celebrating' failure of Kangana's film, Richa reacts
100.article_body: Richa Chadha has reacted to political analyst Tehseen Poonawalla's tweet wherein he criticised people who are 'celebrating' the box office failure of Kangana Ranaut's 'Dhaakad'. Richa wrote, "Aligning with power is easy and has obvious rewards like tax exemptions, award, security...So do you not know the reverse also holds true Tehseen? People are expressing dissent in whatever way they can."

101.title: Bengaluru CCB busts drug racket, 5 kg marijuana seized
101.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru Police recently busted a drug racket and arrested two drug peddlers. Officials also seized 5 kg marijuana, 260 grams of hashish oil and 20 LSD strips from the accused. The accused were reportedly sourcing drugs from neighbouring states and selling them to their clients, mainly students and IT professionals, in the city.

102.title: Sri Lanka hikes fuel prices; petrol at an all-time high of 420 Sri Lankan rupees
102.article_body: Sri Lanka has raised its petrol and diesel prices by 24.3% and 38.4%, respectively, a record hike in fuel prices amid the nation's worst economic crisis. The Octane 92 petrol would now cost LKR 420/litre and diesel LKR 400/litre, an all-time high. "Work from home will be encouraged to minimise the use of fuel," tweeted Power and Energy Minister.

103.title: Sonam remembers grandmother on her birth anniversary, shares throwback pic
103.article_body: Sonam Kapoor took to her Instagram Stories to share a post remembering her maternal grandmother on her birth anniversary. She shared a throwback picture of her grandmother, and wrote, "Happy Birthday Nani. I miss you." Sonam's maternal grandmother Draupadi Hingorani Bhambani passed away in 2017 at the age of 88.

104.title: 10-yr-old girl forced to drink liquor, sexually assaulted in Pune
104.article_body: A case has been filed against two men for allegedly kidnapping and forcing a 10-year-old speech-impaired girl to drink liquor before sexually assaulting her in Pune. The girl was playing near her residence when the duo had reportedly taken her away on a bike. The incident occurred on May 20 and later, the duo left the girl near her residence.

105.title: Delhivery rises 10% after its shares list at 1.68% premium
105.article_body: Logistics and supply chain startup Delhivery's shares saw a nearly 10% rise in intraday trade on Tuesday after its stock got listed at ₹495.20 apiece, 1.68% over the issue price, on NSE. On BSE, the shares were listed at ₹493 apiece, a premium of 1.2% over its issue price of ₹487. Delhivery had launched its ₹5,235-crore IPO on May 11.

106.title: PM Modi to attend ISB's 20th anniversary in Hyderabad on May 26
106.article_body: Hyderabad's Indian School of Business (ISB) Dean Madan Pillutla told reporters on Monday that PM Narendra Modi will be attending the institute's 20th-anniversary celebrations on May 26. He said that PM Modi will also plant a sapling, unveil a commemorative plaque and launch ISB MyStamp and Special Cover. The PM will address the graduation ceremony of 930 students, he added.

107.title: Man held by Pune Police in MHADA job paper leak case, 11 held so far
107.article_body: A 31-year-old man, identified as Kanchan Shrimant Salve, was held by the Pune Police's Cyber Cell in connection with the Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority (MHADA) job exam paper leak case. This was the 11th arrest made in the case. However, 80 people, including an IAS officer, have been arrested till now in the five interconnected government recruitment cases.

108.title: Monitor for monkeypox cases, isolate for treatment: TN govt to officials
108.article_body: Tamil Nadu government has directed District Collectors and Commissioners of Corporations to monitor people who have travelled in last 21 days to countries that have recently reported confirmed or suspected cases of monkeypox. State Health and Family Welfare Principal Secretary said that suspected cases should be isolated and contact tracing should be done if a positive case is detected.

109.title: T20 Blast is the best T20 competition in the world: Ex-Eng player Lloyd
109.article_body: Ex-England cricketer David Lloyd said the T20 Blast is the world's best T20 competition because of the joy it brings to spectators. "The T20 Blast is for the people and bringing money into the game. That's a major factor...in saying it is the best," added Lloyd. "[The IPL] is a private enterprise and [is] benefiting already wealthy people," stated Lloyd.

110.title: Karan Johar to host a theme party for his 50th birthday at Yash Raj Studios
110.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar will turn 50 on May 25. To celebrate his birthday, he will host a grand theme party at Yash Raj Studios. While the theme of the party is black and bling, the entire setup of the bash will be designed by Amrita Mahal, who has worked on creating the sets of films like 'Kalank' and  'Brahmastra'.

111.title: I would give him 100/100 as a captain: Mohammad Kaif on Hardik Pandya
111.article_body: Ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said he would give GT captain Hardik Pandya 100 marks out of 100 for his captaincy in IPL 2022 so far. "Hardik has been excellent. He stands at mid-off and keeps interacting with bowlers," added Kaif. "The management...has worked well with the players. After the mega auction many people did not rate them highly," stated Kaif.

112.title: Mumbai local trains on Harbour line disrupted due to power issue
112.article_body: Local train services on the Harbour line in Mumbai were disrupted on Tuesday morning due to power issue. As per Central Railway official, services on the up line (towards Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus in south Mumbai) on the Harbour corridor were held up for about 15 minutes. Nearly 10 lakh commuters reportedly travel daily on the Harbour line.

113.title: 12 booked for raising pro-Pak slogans in Jharkhand's Hazaribag
113.article_body: As many as 12 people were booked for allegedly raising pro-Pakistan slogans during the victory procession of a panchayat samiti member in Jharkhand's Hazaribag. A video of the incident that occurred on May 19 reportedly went viral on social media, following which an FIR was registered. Police said they are investigating the matter and no arrests have been made yet.

114.title: Disappointed with my batting in last few games: Buttler ahead of Qualifier 1
114.article_body: Ahead of the IPL Qualifier One game, Rajasthan Royals batter Jos Buttler has said that he is "disappointed" with his batting performance in the last few matches. "[In] the first half (of IPL) I was playing some of the best cricket I've ever played," Buttler said. "I've obviously been delighted with my form in the IPL," the 31-year-old cricketer added.

115.title: 86 mn-yr-old fossils of flying reptile species found in Argentina
115.article_body: An ancient flying reptile species, called 'The Dragon of Death', that lived 86 million years ago has been discovered in Argentina. Scientists found rocks preserving the reptile's remains in the Andes mountains in Argentina's western Mendoza province. The species predated birds as among the first creatures on Earth to use wings to hunt its prey from prehistoric skies, scientists estimated.

116.title: Odisha church shut amid reports of religious conversions, Sec 144 imposed
116.article_body: A church in Geltua in Odisha's Bhadrak has been shut amid reports of religious conversions and the district administration has imposed Section 144 in the area. Only three persons are allowed to gather in the vicinity of the church, it added. "There were complaints regarding tribals being converted to Christianity," Sub-Collector of Bhadrak Manoj Patra said.

117.title: 61 Pune policemen booked in 37 cases for criminal offences in 4 years
117.article_body: As many as 61 policemen have been booked in four years in 37 cases for criminal offences like rape, molestation, corruption and others, according to Pune Police data. As many as eight cases have been lodged in 2022. In 2021, 12 cases were lodged, of which six were related to corruption and rape, and two were for molestation.

118.title: Committed to make US-India partnership among the closest on Earth: Biden to PM Modi
118.article_body: US President Joe Biden in a bilateral meeting with PM Narendra Modi in Tokyo on Tuesday said, "There is so much that our countries can and will do together. I'm committed to make US-India partnership among the closest we have on Earth." "India and US strategic partnership in the true sense is a partnership of trust," said PM Modi.

119.title: Missing Haryanvi singer's body found after 12 days, family says 'She was only in underwear'
119.article_body: The body of a Haryanvi singer, who had been missing for 12 days, was found mutilated and buried near a highway in Rohtak. Delhi Police arrested two men for allegedly kidnapping and killing her, saying the accused called her on the pretext of making a music video. Meanwhile, her family said, "She had no clothes on except her underwear."

120.title: Head of Akal Takht asks to phase out harmoniums from Golden Temple
120.article_body: Akal Takht Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh has asked Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) to phase out use of harmonium from Golden Temple and replace it with more traditional string instruments. Harmonium is an instrument with colonial roots therefore not an appropriate instrument for 'Gurbani', the Takht said. The Takht administration has given three years deadline to remove harmoniums.

121.title: Haryana Police arrest 2 men for cheating job aspirant’s father of ₹7 lakh
121.article_body: Haryana Police arrested two Punjab residents for allegedly cheating a Kurukshetra resident of ₹7 lakh on pretext of providing a job to his daughter at Delhi's Indira Gandhi National Open University. "Complainant alleged that the duo told him that he would have to pay ₹7 lakh as advance and ₹8 lakh after the work was done," a police spokesperson said.

122.title: Won't need mass vaccinations, just practise safe sex and good hygiene: WHO on monkeypox
122.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has stated that the monkeypox outbreak won't need mass vaccinations like COVID-19, adding that it doesn't spread easily or cause serious disease. Richard Pebody, the head of the WHO's pathogen threat team in Europe, cautioned people to practise safe sex, good hygiene practices, and regular handwashing to avoid infection.

123.title: Zomato shares surge 18% despite ₹360-crore loss in Q4 earnings
123.article_body: Zomato shares surged by 18% during intraday trade on Tuesday, a day after the company announced its March quarter earnings. The firm reported a loss of around ₹360 crore in the fourth quarter, nearly triple from its net loss of ₹134 crore in the year-ago period. At ₹1,211.8 crore, its revenue surged by 75% as against ₹692.4 crore in Q4FY21.

124.title: Quad is not just a passing fad, we mean business: US Prez Biden
124.article_body: Quad is "not just a passing fad, but it means business", US President Joe Biden said, addressing the second in-person meeting between Quad leaders on Tuesday. "We're here to get things done for the region and I'm proud of what we're building together and I look forward to our vital partnership flourishing and for many years to come," Biden added.

125.title: AAP’s Delhi model can’t be replicated everywhere: Himachal CM
125.article_body: AAP’s Delhi model may have worked but they do not have a long-term model for being successful, Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur said. "The model cannot be replicated everywhere as each place has a different set of characteristics," Thakur added. "It worked in Punjab but in Himachal, other parties have failed. Mayawati tried, SP tried...none of them succeeded," he stated.

126.title: Punjab AAP MLA, wife & son convicted in 2011 assault case; get bail
126.article_body: Punjab AAP MLA Balbir Singh, his wife, son and an aide were on Monday sentenced to three years of rigorous imprisonment in a 2011 assault case by a court in Rupnagar. However, the four accused were later granted bail. According to an FIR, the accused had allegedly attacked Singh's sister-in-law and her husband following a land dispute.

127.title: 20-yr-old engineering graduate held with 98 fake currency notes in Guj
127.article_body: A 20-year-old resident of Ahmedabad’s Sola was arrested with 98 fake Indian currency notes of ₹2,000 each. The accused, an engineering graduate, was acting on behest of the main conspirator who hired him as a porter. The main accused used to ask him to purchase mobile phones and other gadgets using the currency, resell them and receive genuine currency notes.

128.title: Australia to prioritise action on climate change: PM Albanese at Quad
128.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese underlined the need to recognise climate change as the main economic and security challenge for the island nations of the Pacific. Addressing the Quad summit, he said, "The new Australian government gives priority to taking action on climate change and building a more resilient Indo-Pacific region through economic, cyber, energy, health and environmental security."

129.title: Musk lost $10 bn net worth in a single day after sexual harassment claims emerged
129.article_body: Elon Musk lost $10 billion of his net worth in a single day after sexual harassment allegations against him were reported. Musk's wealth was about $212 billion on Thursday as per the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, it fell to $201 billion after the report emerged. Currently, at $204 billion on the index, he is still the richest person in the world.

130.title: FTX CEO on TIME's 100 most influential people of 2022 list
130.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried was featured in TIME's 100 most influential people of 2022 list. Bankman-Fried was featured in the 'Titans' section alongside Apple CEO Tim Cook and Amazon CEO Andy Jassy. The list also featured India's richest person Gautam Adani, SC advocate Karuna Nundy and Kashmiri human rights activist Khurram Parvez.

131.title: Group opens fire, stone pelts house in road rage incident in Punjab
131.article_body: A case was filed after a group allegedly opened fire, pelted stones at a house and vandalised vehicles in a road rage incident in Punjab's Ludhiana. A man's car had apparently brushed against one of the accused's vehicles, following which they abused him. Later, the man reached his sister's house and the accused reportedly also came there and pelted stones.

132.title: Feeling bad I hurt my fans, they see me as Sita: Dipika on school uniform pics
132.article_body: Dipika Chikhlia, known for portraying Sita in 'Ramayan', has reacted after getting trolled for posting pictures of herself in school uniform on Instagram. In the now-deleted post, Dipika was seen posing with her friends in a shirt, skirt and tie. Dipika said, "I'm feeling bad...I've hurt my fans...I'm aware...people see me as Sita, not as Dipika...it was...mistake on my part."

133.title: Love you forever and beyond: Aishwarya wishes her mom on b'day
133.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai, along with husband Abhishek Bachchan and daughter Aaradhya Bachchan, visited her mother Vrinda Rai to wish her on her birthday. Taking to Instagram, Aishwarya shared a few pictures from the birthday celebration. She also shared a solo picture of her mother and captioned it, "Happy birthday dearest darling mommy-doddaaa. Love you forever and beyond. God bless always."

134.title: 5 dept heads, 3 deputy commissioners appointed in unified MCD
134.article_body: After the Municipal Corporation of Delhi unification, five departmental heads and three deputy commissioners have been appointed to the capital's civic body. The three deputy commissioners are deputed to the Civil Lines zone, Rohini zone, and Hackney Carriage, Language, Disaster Management and Election, the order said. Notably, the unified MCD formally came into existence on Sunday.

135.title: Cyber crime cases in Mumbai surged by 200% in January-April period: Data
135.article_body: There has been a nearly 200 percent increase in cyber crime cases in Mumbai during January to April period this year, compared to the cases registered during the same period last year, Mumbai Police data showed. As per the data, 1,468 cyber crime cases were registered this year, as compared to 777 cases registered last year between January and April.

136.title: We should never allow Ukraine-like situation in Indo-Pacific: Japan PM at Quad
136.article_body: At the Quad summit in Tokyo, Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said that the Russian invasion of Ukraine challenges the principles which are enshrined in the United Nations Charter. "We should never ever allow a similar incident to happen in the Indo-Pacific region," he added. He urged the international community to listen to the voices of Asian countries.

137.title: 5 dead, at least 80 trapped as 10-storey building collapses in Iran
137.article_body: At least five people were killed after an under-construction 10-storey building collapsed in Iran's Abadan city, Iranian state TV reported on Monday. At least 80 people are still believed to be trapped under the rubble. The owner of the building and the contractor who built it have been arrested, state TV said, quoting local prosecutor Hamid Maranipour said.

138.title: Shreya can read 6 pages of dialogues and remember every word: Dia Mirza
138.article_body: Talking about actress Shreya Dhanwanthary who starred in 'Scam 1992: The Harshad Mehta Story', actress Dia Mirza said, "I didn't know that Shreya has a photographic memory. She can read 6 pages of dialogues and remember every word." "She's also an amazing singer. I discovered it because she was embarrassing the life out of me by singing songs," added Dia.

139.title: Mob came prepared to destroy documents, records were burnt: Assam Police
139.article_body: While talking about the police station that was set ablaze in Assam by a mob on Saturday, Leena Doley, the Nagaon Police Superintendent, said evidence shows that the mob had come prepared to attack the police station and destroy documents. "Many case diaries and other records kept in the building were burnt...We have managed to retrieve some weapons," she added.

140.title: BSF apprehends 20-yr-old Bangladeshi man in Meghalaya
140.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) on Sunday apprehended a 20-year-old Bangladeshi national who entered the Indian territory from the bordering area of East Khasi Hills in Meghalaya. He was trying to hide in the bushes when BSF troops intercepted him, the BSF said. He illegally entered India to go to West Bengal and earn a livelihood, BSF added.

141.title: Hrithik didn't want to sing a line from 'Ek Pal...', it was retained: Lucky
141.article_body: Discussing his song 'Ek Pal Ka Jeena' from Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar Hai', Lucky Ali said, "I had an issue with the word 'aas' in the line, 'Ek chehra khaas hai, milne ki aas hai'." "I discussed this with Hrithik who told music director Rajesh Roshan he didn't want the line," added Lucky. "It was retained," stated Lucky.

142.title: BSF arrests two Indian smugglers with gold worth over ₹6 crore
142.article_body: The BSF on Monday arrested two Indian smugglers with gold worth ₹6.15 crore in two separate incidents in West Bengal. In one incident, a truck driver was arrested for smuggling 70 gold biscuits and three gold bars. While in another incident, a motorcyclist was apprehended with four gold biscuits. The accused were trying to smuggle gold from Bangladesh, BSF stated.

143.title: 14 bodies found on Myanmar beach after boat capsizes
143.article_body: As many as 14 bodies were reportedly found washed up on a Myanmar beach after a boat carrying a group of 61 people trying to reach Malaysia capsized. 35 people, including the boat owners, were rescued alive, said police. According to UNHCR, the deceased include Rohingyas. It said that the tragedy shows the desperation felt by Rohingyas in Myanmar.

144.title: Christian Bale's look as villain Gorr in 'Thor: Love and Thunder' goes viral
144.article_body: Actor Christian Bale's look as villain Gorr the God Butcher in 'Thor: Love and Thunder' has gone viral. The look was introduced to the fans in the film's new trailer. "Christian Bale as Gorr looks terrifying. Love it," a fan commented. "Christian Bale looks crazily good as Gorr!" wrote another.

145.title: Priyanka hosts party at LA home for manager, dances to dhol; video surfaces
145.article_body: Priyanka Chopra hosted a birthday party for her manager Anjula Acharia at her Los Angeles home on Monday where she even danced to live dhol. A video surfaced where Priyanka can be seen coming out of the room holding a two-tier cake. Anjula also shared several pictures from the party and thanked Priyanka for the celebration.

146.title: WB facing ₹1,141 cr revenue loss due to fuel duties reduction: Mamata
146.article_body: West Bengal is facing a total revenue loss of ₹1,141 crore due to reduction of duties on petrol and diesel, CM Mamata Banerjee said. "There is an automatic state tax deduction of ₹1.80 on petrol...₹1.03 on diesel," Mamata added. This comes after the Centre reduced excise duty on petrol by ₹8 per litre and on diesel by ₹6 a litre.

147.title: Motera, not Eden, is my home ground: Wriddhiman Saha
147.article_body: The Gujarat Titans wicketkeeper Wriddhiman Saha has said that Ahmedabad's Motera Stadium is his "home ground" and not Kolkata's Eden Gardens. "My home ground is Motera...Since I'm no longer with KKR," said Saha ahead of their IPL Qualifier One match against Rajasthan Royals at Eden Gardens. Notably, the 37-year-old player has represented Bengal in his entire first-class cricket career.

148.title: India ships rice, other essentials worth ₹43 cr to crisis-hit Sri Lanka
148.article_body: India delivered its first consignment of humanitarian aid worth ₹43 crore to the crisis-hit Sri Lanka on Sunday. Gopal Baglay, the Indian envoy to Sri Lanka, delivered the aid that included rice, milk powder and essential medicines to Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Gamini Peiris. These goods will be distributed among vulnerable families across the country.

149.title: I am testing Starlink on my plane, it's working quite well: Musk
149.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in response to a Twitter user's question about him using Starlink on his plane said, "I am testing Starlink on the plane. Some polishing [is] needed, but it's working quite well." The Twitter user had also asked Musk what he does on a plane, to which he said, "I work."

150.title: Jail officials took his mosquito net citing rules: Gautam Navlakha's partner
150.article_body: Sahba Husain, partner of human rights activist Gautam Navlakha who was arrested in Elgar Parishad-Bhima Koregaon case, said that prison officials, citing rules, have suddenly taken away the mosquito net that Navlakha was using on recommendation of doctor. Navlakha has approached the special National Investigation Agency (NIA) court seeking a mosquito net.

151.title: 'Anek' is not a 100 cr film, it's an important film: Ayushmann
151.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana has called his upcoming movie 'Anek' an "important film", adding that it's "not a 100 crore film". "You can't view Anek through a commercial lens," he added. "You get courage from your commercially successful films to do films like Anek and Article 15," Ayushmann further said. Directed by Anubhav Sinha, 'Anek' is set to release on May 27.

152.title: Greek PM no longer exists for me: Turkish Prez Erdogan
152.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said that Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis "no longer exists" for him, accusing Mitsotakis of trying to block sales of F-16 jets to Turkey during a visit to America last week. "I'll never agree to meet with him," he added. Turkey and Greece have been at odds over several issues, such as maritime boundaries and airspace.

153.title: India reports 1,675 new COVID-19 cases, 31 deaths in last 24 hours
153.article_body: India has reported 1,675 COVID-19 cases, 1,635 recoveries and 31 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,022 COVID-19 cases and 46 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 14,841, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,490.

154.title: It's a dream come true for me: Mahesh Babu on film with Rajamouli
154.article_body: Mahesh Babu has said he's very excited about his next film with 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli. "It's a dream come true for me. We've been trying to collaborate for a long time and it's finally happening," he added. Mahesh further said he loves the action genre and credited Rajamouli for taking it to "an altogether new level".

155.title: T'gana BJP workers to go door-to-door to brief people on welfare schemes
155.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Tarun Chugh said that the state BJP workers would inform people about the party's welfare schemes on the completion of eight years of PM Modi's government. "BJP workers will go to every house for 14 days and brief [people]," Chugh said. The program will be started by JP Nadda in Delhi from May 30, he added.

156.title: 7 dead, 26 injured as bus collides with lorry in Karnataka's Hubballi
156.article_body: At least seven people died and 26 were injured after a passenger bus collided with a lorry on the outskirts of Karnataka's Hubballi, police said on Tuesday. The accident took place when the bus driver was trying to overtake a tractor, police added. Notably, the drivers of both the vehicles died on the spot, police further said.

157.title: Ukraine a global issue, not just a European one: Biden in Asia
157.article_body: The crisis in Ukraine is "more than just a European issue, it's a global issue", US President Joe Biden said at a meeting of the Quad grouping of countries in Tokyo. "We're Indo-Pacific powers. As long as Russia continues...war, we're going to be partners and lead a global response," he added. The Quad comprises India, the US, Japan and Australia.

158.title: Activision illegally threatened staff over social media policy: US NLRB
158.article_body: The US NLRB has said that 'Call of Duty' maker Activision Blizzard enforced a social media policy that conflicted with workers' rights and allegedly illegally threatened staff in the policy's enforcement. "These allegations are false. Employees may and do talk freely about these workplace issues without retaliation," the firm said. It added its social media policy doesn't restrict communication.

159.title: BJP searches votes in temples, we search God in Shivling: Cong leader
159.article_body: The BJP searches for votes in the temple while the Congress searches for "God in Shivling", Congress leader Pramod Krishnam said. He was speaking on the Shivling claimed to be found inside the Gyanvapi Mosque. "Our party works on the ideology of 'Sarvdharm Sambhav'. We are followers of Mahatma Gandhi. Will follow court's judgement," Krishnam added.

160.title: Bihar journalist who reported on liquor, sand mafias shot dead
160.article_body: A 26-year-old journalist, Subhash Kumar Mahto, was shot dead outside his house while returning from a community dinner in Bihar's Begusarai on Friday. The victim's family claimed his reporting on liquor and sand mafias in the region was the reason he was killed. However, the police said a verbal spat during a wedding celebration could be the reason.

161.title: Hyderabad Police averts child marriage, minor girl rescued
161.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Monday informed that a child marriage attempt was averted in Ambothu Thanda village, under Manchal police station. A She Team from Ibrahimpatnam division, along with officials from Childline stopped the wedding and rescued the minor girl, police said. According to Rachakonda Police, the She Teams have prevented about 11 child marriages in past eight weeks.

162.title: Disappointed how WHO report on excess COVID-19 deaths prepared: India at Geneva
162.article_body: Addressing the 75th World Health Assembly in Geneva on Monday, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said, "India would like to express its disappointment over the manner in which the report by WHO on all-cause excess mortality was prepared and published." He added that the concerns expressed by India and other countries over the methodology and sources of data were ignored.

163.title: Serum Institute planning to set up its 1st manufacturing plant in Africa
163.article_body: The Serum Institute of India is planning to set up its first manufacturing plant in Africa in its efforts to expand globally. CEO Adar Poonawalla said he was meeting African officials in Davos for the same and also said that such projects usually require an investment of around $300 million. He didn't mention what products the African plant might make.

164.title: 8 ex-MLAs join Congress in Haryana, 'party on comeback' says Hooda
164.article_body: As many as eight former MLAs joined Congress in Haryana on Monday. They include Sharda Rathore, Ram Niwas Ghorela, Naresh Selwal, Parminder Singh Dhull, Zile Ram Sharma, Rakesh Kamboj, Rajkumar Valmiki and Subhash Chaudhary. "The party is on a comeback in Haryana," Congress leader and former CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda said on the occasion.

165.title: I don't enjoy drawing a line on butter, I do it on a stone: PM Modi in Tokyo
165.article_body: During his interaction with Indian community in Tokyo, PM Narendra Modi said the values he has imbibed in his life helped him develop a tough resolve to face life's challenges. "Mujhe makhan par lakeer karne mein maza nahi aata hain...main patthar par lakeer karta hoon (I don't enjoy drawing a line on butter...I do it on a stone)," he stated.

166.title: Sang 2 songs for 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar hai', haven't watched the film: Lucky Ali
166.article_body: Singer-songwriter Lucky Ali said that he sang two numbers for the film 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar hai' but hasn't watched the film yet. "[It's] not because of any reason...It just didn't happen," he said. Lucky also said that the first four lines of the song 'Ek Pal Ka Jeena' were contributed by him. "Lyricist Vijay Akela developed on that," he added.

167.title: Unlike Shakhas they teach empathy: Owaisi on Assam CM’s ‘madrasa’ remark
167.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi reacted to Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma’s 'madrasa' remark, saying that they teach self-respect and empathy “unlike Shakhas”. "Illiterate Sanghis wouldn’t understand. Why did Hindu social reformer Raja Ram Mohan Roy study in a madrasa?" Owaisi tweeted. "Obsessing over Muslim ancestry shows your inferiority complex," he added.

168.title: Body of 1 out of 2 farmers trapped in 40-ft-deep tubewell pit in Hisar found
168.article_body: The body of one of the two farmers, who got trapped in 40-foot-deep tubewell pit after portion of land collapsed on them in Hisar on Sunday, has been retrieved. The army and NDRF teams dug about 53 feet into the pit, but the other farmer hasn't been traced yet as gusty winds accumulated loose soil inside the pit, police said.

169.title: Ghaziabad gets ₹15 cr to carry out air quality improvement measures
169.article_body: Ghaziabad, which ranked as the second-most polluted city as per World Air Quality Report-2021, received ₹15 crore for air quality improvement. The city is already listed among 16 non-attainment areas in UP, suffering from high levels of pollution. "It is expected that this is one of the instalments and we are likely to receive more funds," Ghaziabad Municipal Commissioner said.

170.title: Noida Authority to cover stormwater drains after residents complain
170.article_body: The Noida Authority has decided to begin covering the city's stormwater drains with slabs after several residents complained of foul smell, because of garbage, emanating from them. Before covering the drains, the authority is going to repair the banks of the drains, an official said. In the first phase, the authority will take up only 10 drains, the official added.

171.title: YSR Congress Party MLC held on charges of murdering his driver: Police
171.article_body: YSR Congress Party MLC Ananta Satya Uday Bhaskar was arrested in Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada for allegedly murdering his former driver, police said. "He was also charged with screening of evidence...sought to portray it as an accident," Kakinada SP said. Bhaskar allegedly hit the victim during an argument, following which he fell on an iron grill and sustained a head injury.

172.title: Tesla still believes in ESG: Investor after Musk calls it 'scam'
172.article_body: Tesla investor John Streur has said the automaker still believes in ESG indexes after it was cut from S&P 500 ESG Index last week. Streur's comment comes after Tesla CEO Elon Musk criticised S&P Global Ratings and called ESG a "scam". Asked if Musk believes in ESG, Streur said, "I can't speak for him, but I think his company does."

173.title: Tried to be oversmart when I was young, got thrashed miserably: Nawazuddin
173.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said he tried to be oversmart when he was young, adding he was thrashed miserably. "We were playing a match on the field and another team insisted on playing first...so I went near him and said, 'What are you saying?'. He looked at me, picked up a bamboo stick and thrashed me so badly," stated Nawazuddin.

174.title: Airbnb to close its business in China amid tight COVID-19 restrictions
