174.article_body: Airbnb is shutting down its domestic business in China amid the country's tight COVID-19 restrictions. All listings for homes in the country will be removed from July 30. While Airbnb set up its business in China in 2016, stays in the country accounted for only 1% of the company's revenue over the last few years.

175.title: He used to say 'I haven't faced camera for 30 yrs': Dalip on Rajiv Kapoor
175.article_body: Speaking about working with late actor, Rajiv Kapoor in 'Toolsidas Junior', actor Dalip Tahil said,  "He had...many doubts. He told me 'I have not faced camera for 30 years' and I thought 'What is all this talk about nepotism'." "He (Rajiv) was...excited [for the film] and [did] a great job after the first few days of nervousness," he added.

176.title: No new 'fever' deaths, COVID-19 situation stable: North Korea
176.article_body: North Korea on Tuesday said there were no new deaths among "fever" patients in the country, the first time since it confirmed a COVID-19 outbreak on May 12. The country is seeing a "stable" downward trend in pandemic-related cases, state news agency KCNA said. North Korea has reported nearly three million 'fever' cases and 68 deaths so far, KCNA added.

177.title: Noida Authority cancels tenders of 60 surface parking lots
177.article_body: The Noida Authority cancelled the tenders of 60 surface parking lots as the residents complained about being harassed and overcharged. "We have cancelled the tenders allowing fresh contractors to take over," a senior official said. The surface parking sites are located beside multi-level car parking facilities in Sectors 18, 38A, and underground parking in Sectors 16A, 1, 3 and 5.

178.title: Mumbai zoo sees over 26,000 visitors in a day; collects ₹9 lakh revenue
178.article_body: Mumbai's Byculla zoo saw a record number of visitors on Sunday with 26,173 people visiting the place. The zoo collected ₹9,74,325 revenue on Sunday. Reports said the average weekday footfall at the zoo ranges from 4,000 to 5,000, which increases to 15,000-18,000 on weekends. The zoo has now also set up a selfie point and introduced virtual tours for public.

179.title: Pune man attacked over complaint against illegal liquor den, 2 held
179.article_body: A 31-year-old man was allegedly attacked by a group for filing a police complaint against an illegal liquor den in Pune, police said. Two persons have been arrested on attempt to murder charge and four others have been booked, police added. The accused allegedly attacked the man with stones and an iron rod following which he sustained severe injuries.

180.title: Bengaluru's Visvesvaraya rail terminal to open on June 6
180.article_body: Sir M Visvesvaraya Terminal in Bengaluru will start train services from June 6, over 14 months after it was completed. The operations were reportedly delayed due to PM Narendra Modi's unavailability to inaugurate the terminal. The inauguration, which was initially planned for March 15, 2021, will be done later, although the services will be made open to the public before.

181.title: Hyd to witness dry weather conditions, temp likely around 39-40°C: IMD
181.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Monday predicted that dry weather conditions are likely to prevail over Hyderabad during the next 24 to 48 hours. The temperature is likely to remain between 39 to 40°C in Hyderabad during the period, it reported. However, temperature in north and north-east Telangana is expected to be around 40 to 42°C, the IMD added.

182.title: Delhi civic bodies unified, now release pending salaries: AAP to Centre
182.article_body: After Delhi's three civic bodies were unified into one Municipal Corporation of Delhi, Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) asked the Centre to release the pending salaries of the employees. The teachers of municipal schools have not been paid salaries for the past six months while sanitation workers have remained unpaid for almost three months, AAP's Durgesh Pathak claimed.

183.title: Man held for distributing pamphlets with false allegations in Hyd
183.article_body: Hyderabad City Police on Monday said that they have arrested a 44-year-old man for being involved in the alleged distribution of pamphlets containing derogatory and false claims. A 49-year-old man had filed a complaint in the matter in January. The complainant stated that the pamphlets contained "false" allegations against him and also "defamed" police personnel, the police added.

184.title: I don't use flight attendants: Musk amid claims of sexually harassing an air hostess
184.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk while replying to a follower wrote, "Astute observers of my plane...will note...I don't use a flight attendant." Musk has been accused of sexually harassing a SpaceX employed flight attendant in 2016. The follower had shared a statement by the SpaceX President, to which Musk also said, "Only fruit and nuts are stocked on the plane."

185.title: TN minor involved in hoax bomb emails to B'luru schools: Police
185.article_body: Over a month after hoax bomb threats were sent via emails to over a dozen schools in Bengaluru and Bhopal, the police traced the case to a minor boy from Tamil Nadu. The boy did not send the emails himself, but he created a programme that was used to mask the IP addresses of email senders, according to police.

186.title: Quad a force for good, helps Indo-Pacific become a better region: PM Modi in Tokyo
186.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday attended the second in-person Quad meeting in Tokyo. PM Modi said Quad has emerged as a "force for good", adding, "Mutual trust gives new energy to democratic nations. Quad helps the Indo-Pacific become a better region." The summit is being attended by US President Joe Biden, Japanese PM Fumio Kishida and Australia's PM Anthony Albanese.

187.title: Toyota to cut global production plan by 1,00,000 in June
187.article_body: Toyota Motor will cut its global production plan by about 1,00,000 to roughly 8,50,000 vehicles in June due to chip shortage. The firm said that chips shortage, COVID-19 outbreaks and other factors "are making it difficult to look ahead". However, it didn't change its estimate of producing about 9.7 million vehicles globally by March 2023.

188.title: 1 person narrowly escapes as tree falls on 3 vehicles in Pune
188.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver had a narrow escape in Pune on Monday after a tree fell on his vehicle, a car and a two-wheeler, that were all parked. According to the car's owner, the incident occurred as the auto-rickshaw driver was starting his vehicle, which was parked behind the four-wheeler. "Traffic resumed after one hour," a fire brigade official said.

189.title: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' gets biggest opening weekend for a Bollywood film in 2022
189.article_body: Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani-starrer 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has got the biggest opening weekend of the year for a Bollywood film. The film earned ₹55.96 crore in the first three days of its release. The previous Bollywood film with the biggest opening weekend of 2022 was Alia Bhatt's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', which had earned ₹39.12 crore.

190.title: Vacate govt-owned housing colonies by July 26: Air India tells staff
190.article_body: Air India has asked its employees to vacate the government-owned housing colonies by July 26, according to an official document. While Tata Group won the bid for Air India last year, as per terms of disinvestment, the airline's non-core assets such as housing colonies will remain with the government. Air India has two major housing colonies in Delhi and Mumbai.

191.title: No one talked to me, Aditya Chopra at party; Anil only hung out with us: Karan
191.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar recalled attending a party with filmmaker Aditya Chopra during the initial days of his career and called actor Anil Kapoor his "first friend in business". While talking about Anil, Karan said, "Me and Aditya Chopra were at...a party once...no one was talking to us...and then there was...a superstar who walked toward us...and only hung out with us."

192.title: False allegations: SpaceX President on sexual harassment claims against Musk
192.article_body: SpaceX President Gwynne Shotwell has defended CEO Elon Musk against the sexual harassment allegations reported against him recently. In an email to the staff, Shotwell wrote, "Personally, I believe the allegations to be false; not because I work for Elon, but because I've worked closely with him for 20 years and have never seen nor heard anything resembling these allegations."

193.title: 50,000 engineers take the next step in their careers: Scaler
193.article_body: Co-founder of the EdTech startup, Scaler, Anshuman Singh, uncovers what it takes to work at top tech companies worldwide. Ex-Lead Engineer at Meta, Anshuman guides users with a solid career path towards becoming the top 1% of Full-Stack Engineering talent globally, stated Scaler. He shares his years' worth of experience in a few hours through live classes, it added.

194.title: 61-year-old man dies while having intercourse in Mumbai hotel
194.article_body: A 61-year-old man died in a hotel in Mumbai's Kurla on Monday while having sexual intercourse with a 40-year-old woman he claimed was his partner, a police official said. During the intercourse, the man tried drinking alcohol but fell unconscious, the official said quoting the man's partner. The man, a resident of Worli, was later declared dead at a hospital.

195.title: Supernovas record highest-ever total in Women's T20 Challenge, defeat Trailblazers
195.article_body: Harmanpreet Kaur-led Supernovas defeated Smriti Mandhana-led Trailblazers by 49 runs in the first match of Women's T20 Challenge 2022. Driven by Harmanpreet's 37(29) and Harleen Deol's 35(19), Supernovas put up a total of 163/10, which is the highest total in Women's T20 Challenge history. Pooja Vastrakar recorded figures of 4-0-12-4 as Trailblazers were restricted to 114/9 in their 20 overs.

196.title: Risk of global recession lower than individual nations entering it: Gopinath
196.article_body: The risk of global recession is lower than individual countries going into recessions, IMF's First Deputy MD Gita Gopinath said on Monday. "Inflation is a serious concern in many parts of the world," Gopinath stated. She noted that India is in a better position to handle volatility than other countries due to its $600 billion in reserves.

197.title: RBI sets up panel to review customer service standards in banks
197.article_body: The RBI on Monday said it has set up a six-member committee to review customer service standards in banks, NBFCs and other entities regulated by it. The committee will evaluate the efficacy, adequacy and quality of customer service and also suggest measures. It will submit a report in three months from the date of its first meeting, the RBI added.

198.title: Govt issues warning for restaurants, says 'can't force customers to pay 'service charge''
198.article_body: The Department of Consumer Affairs on Monday cautioned restaurants that are forcefully making customers pay 'service charges', the government said. It stated that service charge is voluntary and at the discretion of consumers. This comes after a Hyderabad restaurant was fined for forcing a customer to pay service charge.

199.title: N Korea's Kim attends funeral without mask amid 2.8 mn 'fever' cases in the country
199.article_body: North Korea's Kim Jong-un was seen without a mask at a funeral organised for one of his mentors, even as the country reported 2.8 million fever cases after confirming a COVID-19 outbreak. The funeral was attended by hundreds. Photos showed Kim flanked by officials and military generals wearing masks during the funeral of Korean People's Army marshal Hyon Chol-hae.

200.title: Was triggered by jokes on LGBTQ+ community: Dave Chappelle's attacker
200.article_body: Isaiah Lee, the man who attacked comedian Dave Chappelle onstage during a performance, said he was "triggered" by Chappelle's jokes on the LGBTQ+ community and homeless people. "I identify as bisexual...and I wanted him to know what Dave said was triggering," he stated. "I wanted him to know...he should consider....running his material by people it could affect," he added.

201.title: Ukraine is probing 13,000 alleged Russian war crimes: Official
201.article_body: Ukraine's Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova said that Ukrainian authorities are investigating about 13,000 cases of alleged Russian war crimes. The Ukrainian government has accused the Russian forces of committing atrocities and brutality against the civilians during their invasion of the country. However, Russia has denied that its forces have committed war crimes in Ukraine.

202.title: Beijing extends work-from-home order amid spike in COVID-19 cases
202.article_body: Beijing on Monday extended work-from-home orders for its residents, additionally calling for mass testing to curb the rise of COVID-19 cases. Residents heading to work, however, have been asked to produce a negative RT-PCR test report taken within 48 hours. This comes as 99 new COVID-19 cases were detected in the last 24 hours in the city.

203.title: People get stuck mid-air as cable cars stop and swing amid bad weather in MP
203.article_body: People got stranded mid-air in Madhya Pradesh's Satna after their cable cars got stuck and started swinging amid rainfall and strong winds. Around 28 devotees, who were visiting the Maa Sharda Devi Temple on Maihar hill, were stuck for about 40 minutes, according to reports. The ropeway management had reportedly continued the services despite warnings by weather department.

204.title: Over 10 cr displaced across world for first time on record: UN
204.article_body: The number of people forced to flee conflict, violence, human rights violations and persecution has exceeded the milestone of 10 crore for the first time on record, UN Refugee Agency has said. "It's a record that should never have been set," UN High Commissioner for Refugees Filippo Grandi said. The war in Ukraine has displaced 80 lakh within the country.

205.title: Told Ranveer, 'We can come to Cannes every year for 2 weeks': Deepika
205.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone, who is attending the ongoing Cannes Film Festival, said she told her husband, actor Ranveer Singh that they should visit the city every year. "I said to him...'There's no reason for us to go anywhere else or be anywhere else, we just come here every year for two weeks, watch all these movies'," she said.

206.title: Not expecting recession but it isn't out of question: IMF MD
206.article_body: International Monetary Fund's (IMF) Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva on Monday said she doesn't expect a recession for the world's major economies "at this point". However, she added, "It doesn't mean it's out of the question." The "horizon has darkened" since the IMF downgraded its 2022 growth outlook because of war in Ukraine, China's slowdown and global price shock, she added.

207.title: Prepared myself for Nikamma by re-watching Govinda's films: Abhimanyu
207.article_body: Actor Abhimanyu Dassani revealed he re-watched actor Govinda's films to prepare for his character in his upcoming film 'Nikamma'. "I watched a lot of commercial cinema, I...enjoyed re-watching a lot of Govinda sir's films," he stated. "Govinda is supremely talented and I enjoyed my afternoons, re-watching his films," he added. The film also features Shirley Setia and Shilpa Shetty.

208.title: ONGC becomes 1st E&P company to trade domestic gas on IGX
208.article_body: Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) on Monday announced it has become the first exploration and production (E&P) company to trade domestic gas on online delivery-based gas trading platform Indian Gas Exchange (IGX). ONGC said the gas traded was from ONGC Krishna Godavari 98/2 block. "The quantity sold by ONGC through the gas exchange will be enhanced slowly," it added.

209.title: Newborn girl declared dead at hospital found alive in J&K graveyard
209.article_body: A newborn girl who was declared dead at a hospital in Jammu and Kashmir's Banihal was found alive in a graveyard on Monday. Her family was forced to dig up her grave when locals objected to her burial in their graveyard and asked the family to bury her at their ancestral graveyard. Two employees of the hospital have been suspended.

210.title: Mira Rajput gets YouTube Silver Play Button, shares animation of pics
210.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor's wife Mira Rajput recently received the YouTube Silver Play Button which is awarded to channels that have surpassed the milestone of 1,00,000 (or 100k) subscribers. Mira took to Instagram to share an animation of a series of pictures holding the Silver Play Button, writing, "Am I in the sixth dimension? From planning our first video to this!"

211.title: Sri Lanka arrests 1,500 people in connection with May 9 clashes
211.article_body: The police in Sri Lanka have arrested 1,500 people in connection with the violent clashes that erupted on May 9 amid an economic crisis in the country. The violence erupted in the country after supporters of former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa attacked peaceful anti-government protesters. The clashes had left at least 10 people dead and more than 200 others injured.

212.title: RBI fines Bilaspur Nagrik Sahakari Bank ₹2.5 lakh for violating norms
212.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Monday imposed a monetary penalty of ₹2.5 lakh on Bilaspur Nagrik Sahakari Bank for violation of certain directives issued by it. As per RBI, the bank had not adhered to the prudential inter-bank (gross) exposure limit, among other violations. Last month, RBI fined Bank of Maharashtra ₹1.12 crore for non-compliance.

213.title: Artists can be monsters: Parnalekha on Johnny Depp-Amber Heard case
213.article_body: Actress Patralekhaa's sister Parnalekha took to Instagram Stories to react to the ongoing defamation trial filed by Johnny Depp against ex-wife Amber Heard. Parnalekha shared a screenshot of a news article with the headline, 'Johnny Depp's admirers disturbingly backing Marilyn Manson'. She wrote along with it, "Artists can be monsters and that sometimes our heroes can become our private monsters."

214.title: Saw father beat mother when I was 9 & didn't do anything, felt like a coward: Will
214.article_body: In an interview with David Letterman, Will Smith revealed, "I've always thought of myself as a coward." He said, "When I was 9 years old, I saw my father beat up my mother and I didn't do anything...That left a traumatic impression of myself as a coward." The interview was filmed before the Oscars when Smith slapped comedian Chris Rock.

215.title: Poland & NATO trying to seize western Ukraine: Belarus Prez Lukashenko
215.article_body: Amid Russian invasion of Ukraine, Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko on Monday accused Poland and NATO of attempting to dismember Ukraine. "What worries us is that...the Poles and NATO [are ready] to...take western Ukraine like it was before 1939," he added. Parts of western Ukraine were under Polish rule at different times in the past, most recently between two world wars.

216.title: Pak govt considers reducing working days to save fuel: Report
216.article_body: Pakistan's government is considering the possibility of conserving fuel by reducing the number of working days, according to a local news report. With this move, the government aims to save up to $2.7 billion annually, the report said. Notably, this comes amid an increase in oil prices globally due to the conflict in Ukraine.

217.title: Gautam Adani among 3 Indians on TIME's 100 Most Influential People of 2022
217.article_body: India's richest person Gautam Adani, SC advocate Karuna Nundy and Kashmiri human rights activist Khurram Parvez have been featured in TIME magazine's world's 100 most influential people of 2022 list. Adani has featured in 'Titans' section alongside Apple CEO Tim Cook. Nundy and Parvez have featured in 'Leaders' section with Russian and Ukrainian Presidents Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

218.title: Centre relaxes family pension rules for missing central govt staff
218.article_body: Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh has announced that the government has relaxed family pension rules for missing central government employees, particularly those serving in militancy-affected areas like Jammu and Kashmir and Northeast. Now, if a government servant covered by National Pension System (NPS) goes missing during service, benefits of family pension will be immediately paid to the family.

219.title: Ranveer is welcome to walk Cannes red carpet on my behalf: Deepika
219.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone has said that her husband, actor Ranveer Singh is having a good time at the Cannes Film Festival. "Considering this time I'm letting my responsibility take the driver's seat, he is welcome to...walk the carpet on my behalf," she stated. "He is more than welcome to do that. He will ace it for sure," Deepika added.

220.title: Joined BJP because I was impressed by PM Modi's ideology: Khali
220.article_body: Wrestler Dalip Singh Rana, popularly known as 'The Great Khali', said on Monday that he joined BJP because he was impressed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi's ideology. Khali, who made the remarks after meeting Union Minister Jitendra Singh, further stated that he's proud to have joined the party. Khali joined BJP at the party's headquarters in Delhi on February 10.

221.title: 1st looks of Randeep Hooda, Adil Hussain's films unveiled at Cannes
221.article_body: The first looks of Adil Hussain's 'Footprints on Water' and Randeep Hooda's 'Rat on a Highway' have been unveiled at the ongoing 2022 Cannes Film Festival. Adil's 'Footprints on Water' marks the directorial debut of filmmaker Nathalia Syam while Randeep's 'Rat on a Highway' is directed by Vivek Chouhan. Both films are produced by Mohaan Naadar.

222.title: Pepperfry to file prospectus for $250 million-IPO in June: Report
222.article_body: Pepperfry has kicked off plans to raise $250 million through an IPO in 2022, Moneycontrol reported. The IPO prospectus, which is being prepared currently, is likely to be filed with market regulator SEBI by June. Pepperfry aims to raise the funds through a combination of primary and secondary issuance of shares and the final IPO size may vary later.

223.title: Why don't you love me?: Maha Man asks 18-yr-old before slitting her throat
223.article_body: A 20-year-old man asked an 18-year-old girl, "Why don't you love me?" before he allegedly slit her throat in Maharashtra's Aurangabad on Saturday, police said. The accused, Sharan Singh Sethi, used to stalk the victim, Sukhpreet Kaur, who was a student at Deogiri College. Sethi stabbed Kaur at least 17 times with a 'kirpan' in the vicinity of the college.

224.title: I consulted a psychiatrist after Rishi Kapoor's demise: Neetu Kapoor
224.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor has revealed that she had to consult a psychiatrist after her husband late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor's demise. "But then I said, 'I am stronger than what the doctor is saying'," she added. The actress further said that she dealt with her "missing him" and "feeling low" feelings within herself and made herself stronger.

225.title: 87 killed in strikes on Ukrainian barracks last week: Zelenskyy
225.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday said that 87 people were killed in a Russian airstrike on barracks housing troops at a training base in the town of Desna. Earlier, Russia had claimed that it hit a base with long-range missiles. The disclosure has demonstrated Russia's ability to inflict huge losses, even far from the front, according to Reuters.

226.title: 99% of my wealth in Zomato, everything else doesn't even matter: CEO Goyal
226.article_body: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal said over 99% of his "present/future wealth" is in Zomato and "everything else doesn't even matter". Speaking about Zomato's investments in companies that he has previously invested in, Goyal said, "I'm using my personal money to increase the value of our [Zomato] shares." He added, "My private investments help me learn...and transform Zomato for the better."

227.title: Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Animal' has heroism: T-Series' Bhushan Kumar
227.article_body: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar, speaking about Ranbir Kapoor's 'Animal', has said, "Animal has heroism, songs, real dialogue-baazi (real dialogue-exchange), and father-son emotion." Bhushan further called Sandeep Reddy Vanga a "completely focused director". The film also features Rashmika Mandanna. "There isn't pressure with the movie but more confidence that film can become a huge one," he added.

228.title: Vinai Kumar Saxena appointed as the new Lt Governor of Delhi
228.article_body: The Rashtrapati Bhavan has announced that President Ram Nath Kovind has appointed Vinai Kumar Saxena as the new Lieutenant Governor of Delhi "with effect from the date he assumes charge of his office". This comes days after Anil Baijal resigned as the Lieutenant Governor of Delhi reportedly citing personal reasons.

229.title: Putin jokes about being 'blamed for chaos' by the West, says 'will have a talk'
229.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday joked with Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko about assertions by western nations that Putin's war on Ukraine was to blame for all the current 'chaos'. "They got inflation yet the truth is...'Putin is to blame for everything'," said Lukashenko to which Putin replied jokingly, "We will have a serious talk [with] them."

230.title: Bitcoin recovers to $30,000 after longest run of weekly losses since 2011
230.article_body: Bitcoin on Monday recovered to trade above $30,000 after the recent collapse of algorithmic stablecoin TerraUSD triggered a massive selloff in cryptocurrencies. The gain comes after Bitcoin fell for seven straight weeks, marking the longest losing streak for the world's largest cryptocurrency since August 2011, as per Bloomberg. Bitcoin rose 1.7% to trade at around $30,425 in London on Monday.

231.title: Imran Khan is out to begin civil war in Pakistan: PM Shehbaz Sharif
231.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif on Monday accused his predecessor Imran Khan of wanting to unleash a  "civil war" in the country. Sharif's comment came after Khan asked his supporters to peacefully march in country's capital Islamabad on May 25 demanding dissolution of parliament and subsequent general elections. Khan was ousted as PM via a no-trust vote in parliament last month.

232.title: BJP rule worse than that of Hitler, Stalin, Mussolini, says Mamata
232.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that the BJP's rule is worse than that of dictators Adolf Hitler, Joseph Stalin or Benito Mussolini. Mamata further accused the BJP-led central government of interfering in the state's affairs using central agencies. "The agencies must be granted autonomy and allowed to work impartially without any political interference," she added.

233.title: Cong' existence on ventilator, idiocy of its leaders on accelerator: Naqvi
233.article_body: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said that the Congress' existence is on a "ventilator", adding that the "idiocy" of its leaders is on an "accelerator". Congress leaders defame India in a foreign country, Naqvi added. His comments come after Congress' Rahul Gandhi, at a recent event in London, accused the BJP-led Centre of destroying India's institutions and polarising the country.

234.title: Missing Nigerian lawmaker's severed head found in park: Police
234.article_body: The severed head of Okechukwu Okoye, a legislator in the Anambra state assembly who went missing last week, was found in a park on Saturday night, the police said on Sunday. "There is no suspect in custody yet," a police spokesperson said. The Anambra Governor has offered a 10 million naira ($24,000) reward for information on the killers.

235.title: Kolkata Metro to run special midnight services for IPL matches on May 24 & 25
235.article_body: Kolkata Metro will run special midnight services for those going to watch IPL matches at Eden Gardens on May 24 (Tuesday) and May 25 (Wednesday). One pair of additional services will run at midnight from Esplanade station towards Dakshineswar and Kavi Subhash stations after the matches, an official statement said. These trains will stop at all stations on the way.

236.title: India probing 3 incidents where pilots had to shut down plane engines mid-flight: Report
236.article_body: India is investigating three separate incidents where pilots had to shut down plane engines mid-flight in the last two months, Bloomberg reported. The incidents reportedly involved engines made by GE and France's Safran SA joint venture. The commanded in-flight shutdowns, when pilots intentionally turn off one of the two engines after facing problems, may have stemmed from different issues.

237.title: Pakistani-origin Spanish sisters shot dead in honour killing; 6 arrested
237.article_body: Authorities in Pakistan's Punjab province on Sunday arrested six men from same family in connection to murder of two Pakistani-origin Spanish sisters. The victims, Arooj Abbas and Aneesa Abbas, were allegedly tortured and shot dead by their relatives on Friday after failing to procure their husbands' visas to settle with them in Spain. The women were married to their cousins.

238.title: 3 of same family killed in attack by herd of wild elephants in Assam
238.article_body: Three members of the same family, including an eight-year-old child, were killed in an attack by a herd of wild elephants in Assam, according to Lakhipur Forest Ranger Dhruba Dutta. According to Dutta, the elephants had entered the village area to search for food. As per reports, there are around 42 wild elephants under Lakhipur Forest Range.

239.title: Kiara Advani is Dharma Productions' lucky mascot: Karan Johar
239.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar called actress Kiara Advani "the lucky mascot" of his production house Dharma Productions at the trailer launch of 'Jugjugg Jeeyo'. "She became an absolute must...she's a blessing...Every time she's been on screen, she has been spelling pure magic for us at Dharma Productions," Karan said. Kiara has worked with Karan in 'Lust Stories', 'Good Newwz' and 'Guilty'.

240.title: 5G mass adoption won't happen overnight: Vodafone Idea CEO
240.article_body: Mass adoption of 5G won't happen overnight as it lacks scalable use cases, Vodafone Idea CEO Ravinder Takkar told Financial Express. "5G can be an enabler to digital services but can that service be available tomorrow or day after...I don't think that's the case," Takkar said. He added that the upcoming 5G auctions will be different from the past auctions.

241.title: India's GDP growth may have declined to 3.5% in Q4: ICRA
241.article_body: India's GDP growth may have slowed down to 3.5% in Q4 FY22 from 5.4% in the previous quarter, rating agency ICRA said. The GVA seems to have risen even slower at 2.7% in Q4, compared to 4.7% in Q3, ICRA added. It cited impact of higher commodity prices on margins and decline in wheat yields, among others, as the reasons.

242.title: Dia Mirza shared pic in burqa from 'Dhak Shak' sets shooting in 47°
242.article_body: Actress Dia Mirza on Monday took to Instagram to share a behind-the-scenes picture from the sets of her upcoming film 'Dhak Dhak'. Dia can be seen wearing a burqa and hugging her co-star Fatima Sana Shaikh. The actress wrote in the caption, "Safar mein na suffer karne ka ek hee ilaaj hain. Pyaar. Temperature on the day was only 47degrees!!!"

243.title: Iran's Revolutionary Guard colonel shot dead in Tehran
243.article_body: Colonel Sayyad Khodai of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) was shot dead outside his home in Tehran on Sunday by unidentified gunmen on a motorbike. The IRGC said that elements linked to "global arrogance", a reference to the US and its allies, were responsible for the assassination. Iran will avenge the death of Khodai, Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi said.

244.title: Starbucks to exit Russia after 15 years, workers to get 6-month salaries
244.article_body: Starbucks on Monday announced that it will exit the Russian market after nearly 15 years. The company, which has 130 licensed stores in Russia, had earlier suspended all business activity in the country following the invasion of Ukraine. Starbucks has said that it will continue to support the 2,000 workers it employs in Russia, including paying them for six months.

245.title: Monkeypox may've spread by gay, bisexual sex at 2 raves in Europe: WHO Advisor
245.article_body: The spread of monkeypox in developed countries may be a "random event" that can be linked to two recent events held in Europe, a leading advisor to the WHO has said. One of the foremost theories to explain the spread is sexual transmission among gay and bisexual men at rave parties in Belgium and Spain, Dr David Heymann said.

246.title: Censor board didn't touch anything that mattered in 'Anek': Director
246.article_body: 'Anek' director Anubhav Sinha said the Central Board Of Film Certification (CBFC) "didn't touch anything that mattered" in the film. He stated, "Only at the beginning of 'Anek', there's a brawl sequence...where...expletives were used. The censor jury asked me if cutting that would make...difference to the film." "I said it would make no difference, and that was that," he added.

247.title: Won't reduce state VAT on petrol and diesel: West Bengal CM
247.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday said the state Cabinet has decided not to reduce VAT on fuel and accused the Centre of earning huge revenue from excise tax. She termed the recent fuel price cut and cooking gas subsidy announcement as BJP's election stunt. Only a small number of people will be able to avail subsidy, she added.

248.title: Maruti Suzuki to buy 12.09% stake in Sociograph Solutions for ₹2 cr
248.article_body: Maruti Suzuki India (MSI) on Monday announced that it'll acquire a 12.09% stake in AI firm Sociograph Solutions Pvt Ltd (SSPL) for about ₹2 crore. SSPL specialises in visual AI platform, which is predominantly used to help enterprises improve sales experiences and efficiency in their business. This investment would help create "a customised sales experience on the web", MSI said.

249.title: UN human rights chief arrives in China amid Uyghur abuse allegations
249.article_body: UN human rights chief Michelle Bachelet has arrived in China and will visit the country's Xinjiang province amid reports of alleged abuse against Uyghur Muslim community there. She's also expected to meet senior officials at national and local level. An estimated one million Uyghurs have been detained in "massive internment camps" set up for political indoctrination, UN had earlier said.

250.title: DRDO report finds serious battery defects in EVs that caught fire: Report
250.article_body: A Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) report has found serious defects in the batteries of electric vehicles (EVs) that were involved in the recent fire incidents, Free Press Journal reported. The defects reportedly occurred as EV manufacturers may have used "lower-grade materials to cut costs". The manufacturers have now been summoned by the government to submit an explanation.

251.title: Hope to start internet service on SpiceJet aircraft soon: CMD
251.article_body: SpiceJet is hoping to start a broadband internet service onboard its planes soon, the airline's Chairman and MD Ajay Singh wrote in his email to employees on SpiceJet's 17th anniversary. Singh added that the airline will induct more Boeing 737 Max aircraft over the next few months. He congratulated the company for being the country's "largest transporter of COVID-19 vaccines".

252.title: Heatwaves credit negative for India, could worsen inflation, hurt growth: Moody's
252.article_body: The prolonged high temperatures that are affecting much of the northwestern part of India are a credit negative for the country, Moody's Investors Service said in a report. The report stated that heatwaves will curb wheat production and could lead to extended power outages. Therefore, heatwaves could exacerbate already high inflation and hurt growth in India, Moody's analysts further said.

253.title: Video shows 6 men riding a scooter as 1 sits on rider's shoulder in Mumbai; Police reply
253.article_body: A Twitter user shared a video of six people riding on one scooter in Mumbai. After seeking the exact location of the incident from the user, Mumbai Traffic Police replied, "We have informed DN Nagar Traffic Division to look into it." The video showed one of the six men sitting on the last rider's shoulders.

254.title: COVID caused biggest crisis in 100 yrs, but India helped countries: PM
254.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while addressing Indian community in Japan's Tokyo on Monday said COVID-19 caused the biggest crisis in last 100 years. "When it started, no one knew what would happen next. No one even knew whether its vaccine would come or not," he said. He added that India sent medicines to the countries of the world at that time.

255.title: 27-year-old man rapes friend's 14-year-old sister in Pune, arrested
255.article_body: A 27-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his friend's 14-year-old sister in Pune's Bhosari. As per reports, the incident took place when the minor girl was alone in her house and the accused barged into the house. The minor was sent for a medical examination and police raided the accused's house.

256.title: Zomato's net loss nearly triples to ₹359.7 crore in Q4, revenue rises 75%
256.article_body: Zomato on Monday reported a net loss of ₹359.7 crore for the fourth quarter ended March 31, 2022, marking a nearly threefold increase compared to ₹134.2 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. The food delivery company's revenue from operations stood at ₹1,211.8 crore, up 75.01% from ₹692.4 crore in the year-ago period.

257.title: Delhi govt announces free electric bus rides for citizens for 3 days
257.article_body: Citizens of Delhi will be able to travel free of cost for three days in 150 new electric buses from Tuesday onwards. The buses are slated to be flagged off by CM Arvind Kejriwal in the national capital on Tuesday, the Delhi government announced on Monday. The move is aimed at motivating people and spreading awareness about e-buses, officials said.

258.title: Char Dham Yatra to Kedarnath halted amid heavy rains, gusty winds
258.article_body: The Char Dham Yatra to the Kedarnath shrine in Uttarakhand was halted on Monday due to heavy rainfall and gusty winds. However, the yatra to Gangotri, Yamunotri, Hemkund Sahib and Badrinath continued as usual. Over 10,000 pilgrims were waiting for the yatra to resume to the Kedarnath Temple.

259.title: 'Jabba Jabba' voice in 'Chup...' not mine, didn't know about it: Shahid
259.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, whose character in 2006 film 'Chup Chup Ke' pretended to be mute, has revealed that the 'Jabba Jabba' voice in it was not his own. He added that director Priyadarshan got someone in Chennai to dub it without telling him. "At the time I was a newcomer, so you don't get a lot of importance," Shahid said.

260.title: Marico acquires 54% stake in breakfast & snacks brand True Elements
260.article_body: The maker of brands like Saffola and Parachute, Marico, has acquired a 54% stake in True Elements through primary infusion and secondary buyouts, the company said. "True Elements is another step towards expanding our total addressable market in the healthy foods segment," said Marico MD and CEO Saugata Gupta. Several FMCG firms are acquiring digital-first food and beverage brands.

261.title: India held to 1-1 draw by Pak in men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey after second-last minute goal
261.article_body: Defending champions India were held to a 1-1 draw by Pakistan in their opening match of men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey in Indonesia's Jakarta. Debutant Selvam Karthi opened the scoring for India in the ninth minute by converting a penalty corner. Pakistan went on to equalise in the second-last minute with Abdul Rana converting a penalty corner.

262.title: 25 booked for attacking man with swords, rods at his home in Punjab
262.article_body: A 22-year-old man was seriously injured after he was attacked by around 25 men with swords and rods at his residence in Punjab. An old enmity was reportedly said to be the reason behind the attack. Police have booked 25 persons in this connection. The victim's family alleged they had also informed the local police, but no action was taken.

263.title: 'Bhool...' child actor forgets to remove mask for scene, Kartik shares video
263.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has shared a blooper video of child actor Samarth Chauhan while shooting a scene for 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' in which he forgot to take off his mask. Samarth can be seen running into the shot towards Kartik shouting, "I saw it," as someone behind the camera points out his mask before everyone on set bursts out laughing.

264.title: Ukraine's Parliament bans Russian war symbols 'Z' and 'V'
264.article_body: Ukraine's Parliament on Sunday banned the symbols "Z" and "V" that are used by the Russian military to identify its vehicles amid the war. However, the two symbols will be allowed to be displayed in museums, libraries, scientific works, re-enactments, textbooks and similar instances for educational or historic purposes. Notably, neither of the two letters exists in the Russian alphabet.

265.title: We panicked a couple of times vs Aston Villa: Man City's De Bruyne
265.article_body: Manchester City's Kevin De Bruyne revealed his side panicked "a couple of times" while playing against Aston Villa in the final match of the Premier League season. "We tried to stay as calm as possible but sometimes it was a little bit panicked," he added. Manchester City won the Premier League after staging a comeback and beating Aston Villa 3-2.

266.title: DigiLocker can now be accessed via WhatsApp, says govt; reveals process
266.article_body: Citizens can now use the MyGov Helpdesk on WhatsApp to access the DigiLocker service, the government said. PAN Card, driving licence, CBSE Class 10 Passing Certificate and Class 10, 12 marksheets, vehicle RC, two-wheeler insurance and insurance policy can be accessed. Users can send 'Namaste or Hi or Digilocker' to MyGov chatbot on WhatsApp number +91 9013151515 for access.

267.title: IT Ministry scientist dies by suicide by jumping off Delhi's Shastri Bhawan
267.article_body: A 55-year-old scientist working for the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology allegedly died by suicide by jumping off New Delhi's Shastri Bhawan building on Monday, police said. The deceased has been identified as Rakesh Mallik, a resident of Peeragarhi. Mallik was discovered lying dead in front of Shastri Bhawan's gate number two.

268.title: Sri Lankan Prez appoints 8 new ministers amid economic crisis
268.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday inducted eight new ministers into the federal cabinet. Among those sworn in were ministers for departments of water supply, fisheries and agriculture, however, no finance minister was appointed. President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has now reshuffled his cabinet five times, including the appointment of PM Ranil Wickremesinghe, amid ongoing economic crisis.

269.title: Azam Khan moves SC over 'threat' of demolition of Jauhar University
269.article_body: An advocate appearing on SP leader Azam Khan's behalf on Monday sought an urgent hearing against the alleged impending threat of demolition of Mohammad Ali Jauhar University, as part of the condition of his bail. The advocate mentioned the matter for an urgent hearing before a vacation bench, which asked Khan to approach the mentioning registrar to list his plea.

270.title: Mumbai woman, lover arrested for stabbing her husband to death
270.article_body: A 34-year-old woman and her paramour were arrested by Mumbai Police on Sunday for stabbing her husband to death in Govandi. Nazira Khan and Sadare Alam confessed to the crime during a police interrogation, an official said. Wanting to get married, Khan and Alam hatched a plan to eliminate the husband, the official added.

271.title: WhatsApp to no longer support Apple iPhones with iOS 10, 11 from Oct 24
271.article_body: WhatsApp will stop supporting Apple's iPhones operating on iOS 10 or 11 from October 24, 2022, according to screenshots obtained by WABetaInfo. According to WhatsApp Help Center, the Meta-owned messaging app supports iPhones with iOS 12 or newer. "We routinely stop supporting older operating systems to point our resources to supporting the latest ones," WhatsApp further wrote on Help Center.

272.title: Kirit Somaiya's wife files ₹100 crore defamation suit against Sanjay Raut
272.article_body: BJP leader Kirit Somaiya's wife, Medha, has filed a defamation suit of ₹100 crore against Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut in Bombay High Court. Kirit has said that they don't want the defamation money, adding that it should instead be used for social work. Notably, Raut had accused the duo of being involved in the alleged Mira-Bhayandar's public toilets scam.

273.title: Richa Chadha to play sex worker in upcoming audio show 'Baby Doll'
273.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha will be portraying a sex worker opposite Jaideep Ahlawat in the upcoming audio show 'Baby Doll'. "She is somebody who probably got trafficked when she was a child and has been in this sort of trade against her will," the actress stated. She further said that the show uses words which are typically not seen on camera.

274.title: Water supply to be hit in parts of Pune on May 26
274.article_body: Several areas in Pune will have no water supply on May 26 (Thursday) due to repair and maintenance work at various pumping stations. The water supply in these areas will be restored on Friday. The maintenance work will be undertaken at Parvati, Cantonment, SNDT, Warje and Holkar bridge water treatment plants.

275.title: Karnataka CM forms task force in every zone of B'luru amid rainfall
275.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has formed task forces for all eight zones in Bengaluru to monitor development work and take important decisions in cases of emergency like heavy rains. This zonal task force is headed by a Cabinet Minister and consists of all MLAs/MLCs/MPs and zonal officers, Bommai added. The decision comes amid flooding after rainfall in several areas.

276.title: Samantha, Deverakonda suffer back injury while shooting a stunt in Kashmir
276.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Vijay Deverakonda suffered injuries while performing a stunt for their film 'Kushi' in Kashmir. A member of Deverakonda's team said, "[They] had to run a vehicle over the rope tied on both sides of...Lidder river, but unfortunately, the vehicle fell down into...deep water and both injured their backs...They were given first aid on that day itself."

277.title: Tax terrorism persists in case of petrol, diesel: Kerala Youth Cong Prez
277.article_body: Youth Congress Kerala-unit President and Congress MLA Shafi Parambil has accused the state government of "tax terrorism" in the case of fuel prices. "Tax terrorism still persists in the case of petrol and diesel. Even at this moment, the state government levies a tax of ₹24.32 per litre on petrol...charges ₹18.07 per litre of diesel," Parambil said.

278.title: Man accuses Karan of copying his story for 'Jugjugg Jeeyo'; shares script he e-mailed
278.article_body: A man named Vishal Singh has accused Dharma Productions and Karan Johar of copying his script titled 'Bunny Rani' for 'Jugjugg Jeeyo'. "Had registered a story.. #BunnyRani with SWA India Org in January 2020. I had officially mailed Dharma Productions in February 2020 for an opportunity to co-produce," he tweeted. He shared screenshots of the script's excerpts he had e-mailed.

279.title: Making allegations against judges is becoming a new fashion: SC
279.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday said it's becoming a new fashion of making allegations against judges. Such cases are happening in Mumbai, Uttar Pradesh and Chennai on a large scale, it added. The court said this while refusing to interfere with an order of the Madras High Court finding an advocate guilty of contempt and sentencing him to 15-day imprisonment.

280.title: Video of Sanjay Dutt and Ranbir Kapoor chatting on sets goes viral
280.article_body: A video of actors Sanjay Dutt and Ranbir Kapoor chatting on the sets of their upcoming film has gone viral on social media. The two will be seen together in 'Shamshera' and Ranbir earlier portrayed Sanjay in the latter's biopic 'Sanju'. A fan commented on the video, "Ranbir Kapoor copied Rocky Bhai pose," while another wrote, "Reel with real Sanju."

281.title: AC Milan win Serie A title after 11 years, finish above Inter Milan
281.article_body: Italian club AC Milan won its first Serie A title in 11 years after the club defeated Sassuolo by 3-0 on the final day of the competition. The victory gave the club a two-point lead over their city rivals Inter Milan. Notably, two goals were scored by France's Olivier Giroud while one was scored by Ivory Coast's Franck Kessie.

282.title: India supplied COVID-19 vaccines to 100 countries: PM Modi in Japan
282.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while interacting with the Indian diaspora in Japan's Tokyo on Monday said that India has supplied coronavirus vaccines to 100 countries during the biggest crisis in the last 100 years. "India is continuously serving humanity," he added. "No matter how big the challenge is, India will find a solution to it," he further said.

283.title: We've been cautioning, look what happened: RBI Governor on crypto crash
283.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das told CNBC-TV18, "We've been cautioning on crypto and look at what has happened to the crypto market now." Talking about the recent crash in crypto market, he added, "Had we been regulating it...people would be raising questions, 'what happened to regulations?'." He further said crypto will "seriously undermine" India's monetary, financial and macroeconomic stability.

284.title: Found 100 bodies of missing persons in Lonavla forests over years: Official
284.article_body: Anand Gawade, President of Shivdurg Pratisthan, said that 100 bodies of missing persons have been found in Lonavla forests over the years. "These cases include death by suicide, murder and accidents like falling from cliffs," Anand said. Meanwhile, reports said that 600 tourists have lost their way in the Lonavla forests since 2005.

285.title: Japan left huge imprint on Swami Vivekananda's mind: PM in Tokyo
285.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday, while addressing members of the Indian diaspora in Japan's Tokyo, said Japan left a huge imprint on Swami Vivekananda's mind. "Before he went to Chicago, Swami Vivekananda came to Japan," he added. "India and Japan are natural partners," PM Modi said, adding that the relationship with Japan is that of "intimacy, spirituality, cooperation and belonging".

286.title: Japan played key role in India's development journey: PM in Tokyo
286.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while interacting with the Indian community in Tokyo on Monday said India and Japan are natural partners and Japan has played an important role in India's development journey. "Our relationship with Japan is of intimacy, spirituality, cooperation and belonging," he added. PM Modi told the Indian community, "You're strengthening India-Japan ties by living in the country."

287.title: Man shares pics of 'dead lizard in cold drink' at Ahmedabad McDonald's, outlet sealed
287.article_body: A man took to Twitter alleging that he found a dead lizard in his cold drink served by a McDonald's outlet in Ahmedabad. Taking cognisance of his complaint, Amdavad Municipal Corporation Food Safety Officer Devang Patel collected cold drink samples from the outlet and sealed the restaurant with immediate effect. Meanwhile, McDonald's said it was looking into the incident.

288.title: Umran Malik deserves to be picked in India's Test team: Azharuddin
288.article_body: Taking to Twitter, former India captain Mohammad Azharuddin said that SRH pacer Umran Malik deserves to be selected in India's Test side as well. However, he added that managing the 22-year-old pacer's workload will be critical. "Managing his workload is critical, failing which he can succumb to injures," Azharuddin tweeted. Umran scalped 22 wickets in IPL 2022.

289.title: Whenever I come to Japan, I get extreme love from people here: PM
289.article_body: Interacting with Indian diaspora in Tokyo, PM Narendra Modi said, "Whenever I come to Japan, I get extreme love from the people here." "We Indians get attached to our 'Karmbhoomi' with all our hearts but...love for our 'Matribhoomi' never fades away," he added. "We cannot stay away from our motherland. This is one of our biggest strengths," he further said.

290.title: Sri Lankan medicine shortage could soon cause deaths, say doctors
290.article_body: Doctors in Sri Lanka said that a shortage of medicine caused by an economic crisis in the country could soon cause deaths. Sri Lankan hospitals have been forced to postpone life-saving procedures for their patients because they don't have the necessary drugs. If the situation doesn't improve quickly, several patients would be facing a virtual death sentence, a doctor said.

291.title: Kerala Police begins probe into minor boy raising hate slogans at PFI rally
291.article_body: Kerala Police on Monday said they have begun investigating a viral video, in which a minor boy is purportedly seen raising provocative slogans allegedly at a rally of the Popular Front of India (PFI). As per reports, others around the boy were heard repeating the slogans after him. The video purportedly shows the boy seated on another person's shoulders.

292.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar convenes all-party meet to discuss caste census
292.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has called for an all-party meet on May 27 to discuss caste census in the state. "We want to discuss each and every issue related to caste-based census...Leaders of different political parties will give their suggestions which will be a great help," he said. Notably, Kumar recently met Rashtriya Janata Dal's Tejashwi Yadav over same issue.

293.title: People were amazed watching him: Man booked for taking dog to Kedarnath
293.article_body: A man from Noida who has been booked for taking a pet dog to Kedarnath said people were amazed watching him at the shrine. The dog's owner, Rohit Tyagi, said that the husky named 'Nawab' has visited many temples from Kashmir to Kanyakumari. He added that Nawab was overwhelmed with love and blessing from people in the Kedarnath Temple.

294.title: PM Modi welcomed with 'Modi, Modi' chants in Japan; video surfaces
294.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was welcomed by the Indian community chanting 'Modi, Modi' in Japan on Monday. A video showed people also chanting 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' and 'Vande Mataram' after singing the National Anthem. "Whenever I come to Japan, I get extreme love from the people here...The dedication toward Indian culture and language is ever-growing," PM Modi said.

295.title: Disappointed to not see Tripathi's name in India squad vs SA: Harbhajan
295.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Harbhajan Singh, taking to Twitter, expressed his disappointment after batter Rahul Tripathi was not included in the Team India squad for the upcoming five-match T20I series against South Africa. "Disappointed to not see Tripathi's name in the squad. He deserved a chance," Harbhajan tweeted. This comes after the SRH batter scored 413 runs in IPL 2022.

296.title: China responds to Biden's warning on Taiwan, says 'don't underestimate our resolve'
296.article_body: China, in response to US President Joe Biden's warning on claims to Taiwan, said that it's a "purely internal affair", adding, "Taiwan is an inalienable part of China's territory." It added, "No one should underestimate the firm resolve...and strong ability of the Chinese people in defending national sovereignty and territorial integrity." China is "flirting with danger", Biden had said.

297.title: Tonga volcano still intact after record explosion, find New Zealand researchers
297.article_body: Researchers from a New Zealand institute have found the Tonga underwater volcano that erupted earlier this year, still intact. They noticed evidence that it may still be erupting, with a dense ash layer found in the upper water column near the volcano. According to NASA, the Tonga volcano eruption was 500 times more powerful than the Hiroshima atomic bomb.

298.title: Chhattisgarh CM to offer 11,000-metre veil at Danteshwari Temple
298.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Monday said he will offer an 11,000-metre-long veil at the Danteshwari Temple in Dantewada. The CM further said that he will felicitate women workers from the DANNEX garment factory for curating the offering. These women are our sisters [and] daughters. They have created a record," Baghel added.

299.title: India to eventually become leader in green hydrogen: Hardeep Puri
299.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said that India is more conscious of going for green energy than any other country in the world. Puri added that India would eventually become a leader in the green hydrogen space. The target of 20% of ethanol blending has been brought forward from 2030 to 2025 and it would be definitely achieved, Puri stated.

300.title: 1 arrested in hit-and-run case which killed Zepto delivery boy in Delhi
300.article_body: Delhi Police on Monday arrested a man accused in a hit-and-run case in which a delivery executive working with Zepto was killed. Police believe the accused, Sudhakar Yadav, was driving a Tata Nexon in Dwarka on Thursday night when he hit the victim, Karan Raju, from behind. Raju succumbed to his injuries after being rushed to the hospital.

301.title: PM Modi meets leaders of 34 Japanese firms, proposes celebrating 'Japan Week'
301.article_body: PM Narendra Modi chaired a roundtable with the top executives and CEOs from 34 Japanese companies in Tokyo on Monday. PM Modi apprised the business leaders of the recent reforms undertaken by India and invited them to "Make in India for the World". He further proposed celebrating Japan's contribution to India's development journey in the form of a 'Japan Week'.

302.title: No makeup brand in India would put me in their ad film, that hurts: Sunny Leone
302.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone said there is no makeup brand in India that would put her in its ad film. "That hurts, you are like, 'I can be just as good as they are'...A clothing brand that won't give clothes to you to wear...at event because they are like, 'You are not big enough for them'...Then what do...you do?" she added.

303.title: Agnihotri congratulates Kartik for 'Bhool...', says 'Let your work speak'
303.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri took to Twitter to congratulate actor Kartik Aaryan on the success of his latest film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. "Lots of congratulations...to Kartik for wonderful success. Let your work speak and never forget to Ekla Chalo Re," he wrote. The horror-comedy film, which was released on May 20, has collected ₹55.96 crore in India so far.

304.title: Not seeing Nupur Sanon; till the time I don't get married, I'm single: Stebin
304.article_body: Singer Stebin Ben, reacting to rumours of him dating actress Nupur Sanon, said that he's "not seeing Nupur". "We're family to each other. We talk every day and feel both of our careers have started...so we're focusing on our careers," he added. On being asked if he is single, Stebin said, "Till the time I don't get married, I'm single."

305.title: Will explore more EV partnerships: Mahindra CEO after VW deal
305.article_body: Mahindra and Mahindra will explore sourcing more components from other companies for faster growth of its EV portfolio, the company's CEO Anish Shah said. "It's better to source the best...rather than do everything ourselves," Shah added. Last week, Mahindra signed a partnership agreement with Volkswagen (VW) to explore equipping its electric cars with VW's motors and battery components.

306.title: Russian soldier jailed for life in 1st Ukrainian war crimes trial since war began
306.article_body: A Ukrainian court on Monday sentenced a 21-year-old Russian soldier to life imprisonment for killing an unarmed civilian, at the end of the first war crimes trial for the ongoing Russian invasion. Tank commander Vadim Shishimarin had pleaded guilty to killing 62-year-old Oleksandr Shelipov. He had fired several shots at the victim's head on February 28.

307.title: Somewhere deep down, he must be sad: Raina on Dhawan over Team India snub
307.article_body: Talking about Shikhar Dhawan not being selected in India's squad for the T20I series against South Africa, Suresh Raina said, "If you've brought Dinesh Karthik back in the team, Shikhar Dhawan deserved a place too." He added, "Dhawan has scored runs non-stop. Somewhere deep down, he must be sad." Raina stated that every captain wants a player like Dhawan.

308.title: Japan to contribute to smart cities, 5G projects in India: NEC Corporation
308.article_body: NEC Corporation's Chairman Nobuhiro Endo met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Tokyo on Monday and discussed the Japanese company's role in India's telecommunications sector. "From smart cities point of view, we can contribute from the application and...provide the communication platforms like 5G," Endo said after meeting PM Modi. He added that they have the solution to all these areas.

309.title: I was Haasan's make-up artist for 32 days during 'Vikram' shoot: Director
309.article_body: Director Lokesh Kanagaraj spoke about how he got an opportunity to do make-up for Kamal Haasan on the sets of 'Vikram'. "We'd to do blood make-up for him...I asked him if I could do it. He agreed," Lokesh said, adding, "He liked my work...That's how I became...first director to do make-up on...Haasan. I was his make-up artist for 32 days."

310.title: British pitted Hindus against Muslims, today BJP is doing it: Mufti
310.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said the British pitted Hindus against Muslims and today the BJP is doing it. Her statement came in reaction to Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's remark that the madrasa should be a system of education that can give students the choice to do anything in the future. "PM is watching silently," Mufti added.

311.title: Stopped 11 child marriages since January 1 this year: Pune's Bharosa Cell
311.article_body: An officer from the Bharosa Cell of Pune Police said that the teams have stopped 11 child marriages since January 1, 2022. "In six cases, we registered offences after marriages had taken place. We sensitise family members about the social, personal and legal implications of child marriage including legal action under Prohibition of Child Marriage Act, 2006," the officer added.

312.title: Passengers screened for Monkeypox at airport, suspected cases to be isolated: BMC
312.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has readied a 28-bed ward at Mumbai's Kasturba Hospital for isolating suspected cases of Monkeypox. BMC said that the airport authorities are screening passengers from endemic & non-endemic countries that have been showing outbreaks of the disease. The civic body added that the test samples of the suspected cases will be sent to NIV Pune.

313.title: Rishabh Pant cheated of ₹1.63 crore by conman cricketer Mrinank Singh
313.article_body: India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant was cheated of ₹1.63 crore by conman cricketer Mrinank Singh, who's currently under arrest for cheating another businessman. As per a complaint filed by Pant, Mrinank falsely represented that he could procure luxury watches and other accessories on good discounts and "very cheap" prices. Mrinank also produced false references to deceive Pant, the complaint added.

314.title: Rising oil prices pose risk of global recession: IEA Executive Director
314.article_body: International Energy Agency (IEA) Executive Director Fatih Birol said oil producers need to act responsibly to help rein in oil prices, otherwise there's a risk of global recession. "If we don't make a positive contribution here, we may see prices even going higher...becoming a major risk for recession for the global economy," Birol said.

315.title: Used syringes, liquor bottles found in school: Delhi panel as it shares video
315.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) conducted inspections at four schools under the Municipal Corporation of Delhi and termed their condition "pathetic, unsafe and deeply disturbing". Sharing a video of one the schools, DCW stated it found "used syringes (drugs), cigarette boxes, gutkha wrappers and even broken alcohol bottles inside its premises". It sought an FIR in the matter.

316.title: India will work with Indo-Pacific countries for inclusive, flexible IPEF: PM
316.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said during the launch ceremony of the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity (IPEF) that the US-led trade initiative is a "declaration of the collective desire to make the Indo-Pacific region an engine of global economic growth". He added that India is committed to working with all Indo-Pacific countries towards an "inclusive and flexible" IPEF.

317.title: No change in US' policy towards Taiwan: Official after Biden warns China
317.article_body: A White House official said on Monday that there's no change in US' policy towards Taiwan, a remark that came after US President Joe Biden warned China against invading Taiwan. "[President Biden] reiterated our One China Policy and our commitment to peace and stability across...Taiwan Strait," the official added. Biden said US will defend Taiwan militarily if China attacks it.

318.title: T-Series responds to Pak singer Abrar's claim of copied 'Jugjugg Jeeyo' song
318.article_body: T-Series has issued a statement after Pakistani singer Abrar Ul Haq alleged his song 'Nach Punjaban' was 'stolen' for Karan Johar-produced 'Jugjugg Jeeyo'. The record label said it has "legally acquired the rights to adapt the song" for the movie, adding, "All due credits shall be included across all platforms when the song releases." Abrar has threatened legal action.

319.title: Identify fake media groups operating in J-K's Ramban: DM to Police
319.article_body: Ramban District Magistrate (DM) has asked the police to identify fake media groups operating without proper registration in the district in J&K. "Verify the antecedents and source of funding of all so-called journalists who operate these illegal portals without any valid degree, qualification and authority from the competent authority," the DM wrote to the Superintendent of Police (SP).

320.title: Home Minister Amit Shah visits Prime Minister's Museum with his wife; pics surface
320.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah along with his wife Sonal Shah visited the 'Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya' in Delhi on Monday. The museum is a tribute to all the Prime Ministers of India and tells the story of India after Independence through the lives and contributions of its Prime Ministers. It was inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi in April this year.

321.title: Inspector warned me of 'encounter' after bail: SP leader Azam Khan
321.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader (SP) Azam Khan claimed that an inspector in jail had warned that he could be encountered post his bail. "When an inspector [says] 'go underground, you have several cases against you'...it's difficult to say where I'm headed," he added. Khan was granted interim bail by SC in alleged land grabbing case and forgery case in UP's Rampur.

322.title: 7 dead as fire breaks out on ferry in Philippines; video surfaces
322.article_body: Seven people were killed and 127 were rescued after a fire broke out on a ferry in the Philippines on Monday, according to the country's coast guard. A video of the incident shows people jumping off the ferry into the sea as the fire burns. The fire had allegedly started in the ferry's engine room, the coast guard said.

323.title: Jet Airways appoints 4 new senior execs after DGCA nod to fly again
323.article_body: Jet Airways, which was recently granted permit to fly again by DGCA, has announced the appointment of Mark Turner as Vice President (Inflight Product and Services). It has also hired Prabh Sharan Singh as Chief Digital Officer, HR Jagannath as Vice President (Engineering), and Vishesh Khanna as Vice President (Sales). The airline is planning to restart operations in July-September quarter.

324.title: 4 drown, 2 others rescued after boat capsizes in UP's Varanasi
324.article_body: At least four persons drowned and two others were rescued after a boat capsized in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi on Monday. Police rushed to the spot and an NDRF team was called to help in rescue efforts. Officials said the six persons were sailing on river Ganga near the ghat when water started filling up through a hole in the boat.

325.title: 2-day-old baby dies in Sri Lanka as father couldn't find petrol for his tuk-tuk
325.article_body: A two-day-old baby girl died in Sri Lanka after her father was unable to find petrol for his tuk-tuk to take the baby to the hospital amid the nation's worst economic crisis. The parents wanted to rush her to the hospital as she was showing signs of jaundice. She died due to a delay in admitting her to the hospital.

326.title: John Travolta, Stephen Dorff to star in action thriller 'American Metal'
326.article_body: Actors John Travolta and Stephen Dorff are set to star in the action thriller film 'American Metal'. Written and directed by Nicholas Maggio, the film tells the story of a desperate and struggling family man who robs a pill mill, according to Deadline. 'American Metal', which is slated to release in 2023, also stars Shiloh Fernandez and Ashley Benson.

327.title: Akshay romanced Madhuri when I was in school, now romancing Manushi: Kapil
327.article_body: Comedian Kapil Sharma has joked that actor Akshay Kumar romanced Madhuri Dixit and Ayesha Jhulka in films when he was in school. He added Akshay romanced Bipasha Basu and Katrina Kaif when he was in college. Kapil further said Akshay is now romancing younger actresses like Kiara Advani, Kriti Sanon and Manushi Chhillar when he's hosting 'The Kapil Sharma Show'.

328.title: Deepak Chahar would've taken a lot of wickets IPL 2022: Ravi Shastri
328.article_body: Ravi Shastri, speaking about pacer Deepak Chahar, has said, "The biggest problem for CSK was Chahar's unavailability." He added that the pacer would have taken several wickets in IPL 2022 "considering the pitches". CSK's ₹14 crore-buy Chahar was ruled out of IPL 2022 due to a back injury. In IPL 2021, Chahar scalped 14 wickets.

329.title: 24-yr-old man beaten to death over parking dispute in Chandigarh
329.article_body: A 24-year-old man was beaten to death in Chandigarh following a dispute over parking of a two-wheeler in Mori Gate area on Saturday. Four men, who were friends with the man with whom the victim had an argument, have been booked in connection with the case. In a CCTV footage, one suspect was seen punching the victim on head.

330.title: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' talk of the town from 1st poster to now: Kartik
330.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has said that his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has been the talk of the town from the release of its first poster to now. "Everybody has been talking about this film and they have enjoyed it," the actor added. He further said that Kangana Ranaut-starrer 'Dhaakad' has also released, adding that he liked the film's trailer.

331.title: RR has edge over GT because of Ashwin-Chahal combination: Vettori
331.article_body: Ahead of Qualifier 1 of IPL 2022, Daniel Vettori opined Rajasthan Royals has an edge over Gujarat Titans. "I love the R Ashwin-Yuzvendra Chahal combination...that gives Rajasthan something pretty special through the middle," he stated. "Rajasthan are just in front because of those two and Trent Boult," he added. Qualifier 1 will be played at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

332.title: Mumbai civic body begins repair of 295 roads in city
332.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has started the repair work of 295 roads in Mumbai, according to officials. Repair work on another 210 roads will start after the traffic police issue no objection certificates, they added. The civic body had awarded contracts worth ₹2,210 crore for repair of 505 roads this year, according to official data.

333.title: If I was picked by an IPL team, there were chances I wouldn't have got any games: Pujara
333.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara, who has been recalled to India Test squad, suggested that not being picked in IPL was a blessing in disguise. "Had I been picked by an IPL team...there were major chances...I wouldn't have got any games. I would've just gone (to nets) and practised," he added. He stated he played county cricket to get his old rhythm back.

334.title: We're at crossroads: Ex-Twitter India head as his startup runs into 'challenges'
334.article_body: Former Twitter India head Manish Maheshwari said Invact Metaversity is "standing at crossroads" after running into "technology and ecosystem challenges". He said that differences have emerged between him and Co-founder Tanay Pratap regarding the edtech startup's vision. Invact Metaversity is now exploring cutting the burn rate and pivoting to another idea or returning unspent capital to investors.

335.title: Online admission process for Class 11 to start from May 30 in Pune
335.article_body: Pune's Director of Education (Secondary and Higher Secondary) has rescheduled online admissions for Class 11 for the academic year 2022-23. From May 30 onwards, students will be able to register part-1 form of the admission process. This is the second time the admission process has been rescheduled by the education department. Earlier, it was supposed to start on May 17.

336.title: B'luru court rejects anticipatory bail pleas of 2 accused of PSI exam scam
336.article_body: A Bengaluru court has rejected anticipatory bail pleas of two candidates accused of indulging in malpractice in the Karnataka Police Sub-Inspectors (PSI) recruitment exam held in October 2021. One of the candidates is the fourth rank winner among men, while another is the first rank holder among women. Twenty-two people have been named in an FIR in this connection.

337.title: Zinchenko breaks down after draping Premier League trophy with Ukraine flag, pics viral
337.article_body: Manchester City's Ukrainian footballer Oleksandr Zinchenko broke down after draping the Premier League trophy with Ukraine flag. "I'm so proud to be a Ukrainian and I would love to one day bring this title to Ukraine for all Ukrainian people because they deserve it," he said. Manchester City won their second successive Premier League title on Sunday.

338.title: We don't want humanity to end in adult diapers: Musk in warning on low birth rates
338.article_body: Elon Musk said the belief that having fewer children is better for the environment is "total nonsense", adding, "The environment's gonna be fine even if we doubled the [number] of humans." Musk warned against dropping birth rates, adding, "We don't want civilisation to end in adult diapers with a whimper." Humans need to at least "maintain our numbers", he added.

339.title: Sales of many companies I invested in jumped from 3x to 25x: Anupam Mittal
339.article_body: Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal took to Instagram to share a post on how the startups he invested in have grown. He wrote, "Many of the companies I have invested in have seen their sales soar from 3x to 25x...in a few months. Do I pick them right, or is it the Shark Tank magic...or a bit of both?"

340.title: Maybe I didn't give myself enough credit: Deepika on being Cannes jury
340.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone, speaking about being a jury member at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival, said that it came as a surprise and "maybe" she hasn't given herself enough credit. "I don't want [it] to be feeling like...this huge achievement or whatever. If I've landed here today, without even realising it, I must be doing something right," the actress added.

341.title: Whole country rallied behind him: 22-year-old Umran Malik's father on India call-up
341.article_body: Talking about his son receiving his maiden Team India call-up, 22-year-old Umran Malik’s father said, "What could be a bigger achievement than to wear the national colours." He added, "Umran has made all of us proud with his performances in...IPL and the way the whole country rallied behind him, we as a family can only be thankful."

342.title: Star kids do dad's songs, act like mom as they're put into that position: Abhay
342.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol said that star kids often do their father's cover songs or act like their mother because they are put into that situation. While talking about how star kids are expected to work in a certain way, he said, "People said [to me], 'You have a formula made for you, you'd be stupid to turn that down'."

343.title: 8 injured as houses collapse following heavy rains, storm in Delhi
343.article_body: After Delhi was hit with heavy rains and storm on Monday, eight people were injured following collapse of houses in different parts of Delhi, officials said. According to the fire department, three persons received minor injuries after a house collapsed in Jwalapuri. Incidents of houses collapsing were also reported from Gokalpuri, Moti Nagar and Central Delhi's Shankar road area.

344.title: Aditya Narayan shares first picture of his daughter Tvisha Narayan Jha
344.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan on Monday shared a picture of his daughter Tvisha Narayan Jha, revealing her face for the first time. "3 months old tomorrow! Here she is, our beautiful angel," he wrote while sharing the picture on his Instagram handle. Aditya and his wife Shweta Agarwal welcomed their baby girl on February 24.

345.title: 8 migrant labourers die as iron rod-loaded truck overturns in Bihar
345.article_body: At least eight migrant labourers were killed and six others were severely injured as the iron rod-loaded truck that they were travelling in overturned in Bihar on Monday after the driver reportedly lost control of the vehicle. Police said that when the truck overturned, the iron rods fell on the labourers. They died as they were trapped under the rods.

346.title: Sisodia to present 'Delhi Education Model' at Education World Forum
346.article_body: Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia will present the 'Delhi Education Model' at the Education World Forum 2022 in London on Monday. Sisodia took to Twitter and wrote, "Will share the story of 'restoring faith in govt school system' before education ministers and educationists...who are gathered [in London] to discuss the future of education."

347.title: Hyderabad Police bust interstate drug racket, seize 470 kg ganja
347.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police said on Monday that they have busted an interstate drug racket and apprehended 10 drug peddlers. The accused were trafficking drugs from Andhra Pradesh to Mumbai when their vehicle was intercepted by authorities near Hyderabad.
