Police have also recovered materials worth ₹1.20 crore, including 470 kg of ganja, four cars and ₹2 lakh cash from accused's possession.

348.title: IPL cricket betting racket busted in Pune apartment, 5 arrested
348.article_body: Five people have been arrested for allegedly running an IPL cricket betting racket from an apartment in the Pimple Saudagar area of Maharashtra's Pune district. Police have seized 30 mobile phones, three laptops and a counting machine from them. The arrests were made when the accused were taking bets on an IPL match between Mumbai Indians and Delhi Capitals.

349.title: India committed to continue with radical reforms: NITI Aayog CEO
349.article_body: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant on Monday said India is committed to continue implementing radical reforms and that it will make it a leader in global economy. He added that the emergence of unicorns in the country even at the peak of COVID-19  pandemic has been phenomenal. Kant was speaking on the sidelines of the WEF Annual Meeting 2023.

350.title: 40 trains affected as people protest at railway station in Bihar
350.article_body: At least 40 trains were cancelled, short terminated or diverted after people held a protest on the tracks at the Barhiya Railway Station in Bihar. The protesters demanded that the express trains that don't stop at the station should have scheduled halts there for the locals' convenience. The people also prepared meals on the tracks during the protest, PTI reported.

351.title: Husband found guilty of abetting suicide in Kerala student's dowry death case
351.article_body: A Kerala court on Monday convicted S Kiran Kumar, the husband of Ayurveda medical student Vismaya V Nair who died by suicide in her marital home in June last year, for dowry death and abetting her suicide. Officials said the court is expected to pronounce the sentence on Tuesday after hearing arguments on behalf of the prosecution and the convict.

352.title: Varanasi court completes hearing on Gyanvapi Mosque case, reserves decision
352.article_body: A Varanasi court has completed hearing on a civil suit on the Gyanvapi mosque-Kashi Viswanath temple complex dispute and reserved its decision until May 24. The Supreme Court on Friday ordered the transfer of the pending proceedings in the case to the District Judge in Varanasi. It had said that the case should be handled by a senior judicial official.

353.title: Musk's SpaceX looking to raise funds at a valuation of $127 billion: Report
353.article_body: Elon Musk's SpaceX is looking to raise up to $1.725 billion in new capital, CNBC reported citing a company-wide email. The spacecraft manufacturing company will raise new funds at a price of $70 per share, sending its valuation to $127 billion, CNBC added. With this, the 20-year-old company is poised to become the most valuable startup in the US.

354.title: Restaurant fined for forcing customer to pay ₹165 service charge in Hyderabad
354.article_body: A consumer forum in Hyderabad has directed a restaurant, which charged a customer ₹164.95 as service charge last year, to pay a fine of ₹3,000 and refund the service charge to the customer. The customer said that he was forced to pay the service charge even after he showed the restaurant manager information about service charge guidelines.

355.title: Wept loudly when I learnt my film was releasing on OTT, not in theatres: Aditi
355.article_body: Aditi Rao Hydari, speaking about her Malayalam movie 'Sufiyum Sujatayum', said it was a very special film, adding that she "wept loudly" when she learnt that it was going to release on OTT instead of theatres. "Makers took my view...but I realised...I can't put...producers under stress," she said. Aditi added when she "saw...magic of OTT", she realised medium isn't important.

356.title: I never aspired for my movies to be at a film festival: Imtiaz Ali
356.article_body: Filmmaker Imtiaz Ali has stated that he has never aspired for any of his movies to be at a film festival, adding he doesn't have much knowledge about the festivals either. "I know...people that make movies that would go to a film festival...I don't think like that. I want to make movies that people would want to watch," Imtiaz added.

357.title: Search underway to locate Delhi engineer lost in forest area in Pune
357.article_body: An extensive search and rescue operation is underway for a 24-year-old mechanical engineer from Delhi who lost his way in the forest area during a trek near Lonavala in Pune. He had called his brother and some friends and informed them that he had lost his way. Later, his phone became unreachable and he has been untraceable.

358.title: Aditi Ashok calls out Air France over missing golf bag, says 'Need it immediately'
358.article_body: Indian golfer Aditi Ashok took to Twitter to call out Air France over her missing golf bag. She wrote, "Need your immediate response...My golf bag didn't make it on the flight from CDG. I've already shared...bag tag details on DM." She added, "I need it immediately as I've a tournament. Respond immediately and make sure my bag arrives by tomorrow."

359.title: CSK need player like Raina, he was a proven player in IPL: Shastri
359.article_body: Ex-India player Ravi Shastri said batter Suresh Raina was a proven player in the IPL and added Chennai Super Kings need a player like him in the team. "While Ambati Rayudu and Robin Uthappa will still play, it will make a lot of difference if they get some cushion," Shastri stated. CSK finished ninth on the IPL 2022 points table.

360.title: Haryana local body polls to be held on June 19
360.article_body: The Haryana State Election Commissioner Dhanpat Singh has announced that the elections for the 46 local bodies of Haryana will be held on June 19. Voters can cast their votes between 7 am to 6 pm while the counting of votes will take place on June 22. Notably, the process of nomination will continue from May 30 to June 4.

361.title: Govt likely to stick to fiscal deficit target: RBI Governor
361.article_body: There may not necessarily be a need for the government to increase borrowing just yet and the Centre is likely to stick to its fiscal deficit target as specified in Budget 2022, said RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das. "There's no...co-relation between increase in government expenditure...and the need for additional borrowing. These are...figures which keep moving throughout the year," Das added.

362.title: A lot of people had given up on me: Dinesh Karthik on Team India comeback
362.article_body: On being recalled to Team India T20I squad, Dinesh Karthik said that it is "probably" his most special comeback as a lot of people had given up on him. "I am in many ways indebted to RCB for picking me and giving me that role," he added. Karthik has been included in India's 18-member squad for South Africa series.

363.title: Group of millionaires protests, says 'tax us now' amid WEF at Davos
363.article_body: Amid the World Economic Forum (WEF), a group of millionaires protested in Davos and demanded that governments tax the wealthy to tackle the cost of living crises across the globe. "The only credible outcome from this conference (WEF) is to tax the richest and tax us now," said Phil White of 'Patriotic Millionaires'.

364.title: India's future is bright: SoftBank CEO Son after meeting PM Modi in Tokyo
364.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Japanese conglomerate SoftBank's billionaire Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son in Tokyo on Monday. "India is growing quickly. There are new startups and unicorns every day. I think India's future is bright," Son said. PM Modi commended SoftBank's role in India's startup sector and discussed opportunities in research, technology and ways to boost investment linkages.

365.title: Heatwave conditions in Delhi to remain subdued till May 29-30: IMD
365.article_body: Heatwave conditions in Delhi are likely to remain suppressed till around May 29 or 30, on account of active western disturbance that brought rainfall to northwest India on Monday, IMD scientist RK Jenamani said. "The peak of today's thunderstorm and rainfall activity was seen this morning, but cloudy conditions are likely to persist till evening or tomorrow morning," he added.

366.title: Man arrested for molesting girls, aged 9 & 17, on footpath in Pune
366.article_body: A 31-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly inappropriately touched two girls, who are sisters, while they were walking on a footpath outside a housing society in Pune's Sahakar Nagar. A sub-inspector said that the accused was a resident of the same area. The girls' mother had filed a case against the man and accused him of molesting her daughters.

367.title: Crypto has no underlying value, Govt more or less in sync with this: RBI Guv
367.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das while speaking about cryptocurrencies said it is "something whose underlying (value) is nothing". He said that statements coming from the Centre are "more or less in sync" with this. The Governor added, "There are big questions on how to regulate it. Our position remains...clear, it will...undermine the monetary, financial and macroeconomic stability of India."

368.title: How much prize money did the top 6 Premier League clubs win after 2021/22 season?
368.article_body: Manchester City, who won their second consecutive Premier League title, won prize money of £44 million. Second-placed Liverpool, who finished with just one point behind Manchester City, won £41.8 million. Meanwhile, third-placed Chelsea received prize money of £39.6 million. They were followed by Tottenham (£37.4 million), Arsenal (£35.2 million) and Manchester United (£33 million).

369.title: Belgium becomes first country to introduce compulsory monkeypox quarantine
369.article_body: Belgium has become the first country to introduce a compulsory 21-day monkeypox quarantine after four cases were confirmed in the country. Around 14 countries have confirmed outbreaks of the viral disease. The infections in Belgium, the first of which was recorded on Friday, are all linked to a festival in the port city of Antwerp.

370.title: 13 countries to join new Asia-Pacific trade framework, announces Biden; India included
370.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Monday announced in Japan that 13 countries have joined a new, US-led Asia-Pacific trade initiative, the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity or the IPEF. Alongside the US, the other countries included in the framework are India, Australia, Brunei, Indonesia, Japan, the Republic of Korea, Malaysia, New Zealand, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam.

371.title: Akhilesh Yadav has been too used to air-conditioned rooms: OP Rajbhar
371.article_body: SBSP National President Om Prakash Rajbhar said his ally SP chief Akhilesh Yadav has been "too used to air-conditioned rooms". "His party leaders complain that he does not meet anyone. He should venture out more often to constituencies," Rajbhar said. "Akhilesh's leaders have told me that I should advise him so that he meets people," Rajbhar stated.

372.title: Encourages separatists: Himanta Sarma on Rahul's 'Union of States' remark
372.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's "Union of States" remark made in London last week. "He (Rahul) is indirectly encouraging separatist elements by describing India as a federation of states," CM Sarma said. "He is promoting separatist sentiments...There is no difference between his language and that of militant outfit ULFA," he added.

373.title: Gurugram issues work-from-home advisory for private offices due to heavy rain
373.article_body: After Chandigarh weather department’s forecast of rainfall and thunderstorm today, the Gurugram administration has issued a work-from-home advisory for corporate offices. “Private institutions/corporate offices are advised to guide their employees to work from home for today...so that traffic congestion on road can be avoided and repair renovation work...can be done smoothly,” the advisory read.

374.title: 35-year-old businessman shot in face while resisting robbery attempt in Delhi
374.article_body: A 35-year-old businessman was shot in his face while resisting an attempt to robbery in Delhi's Hari Nagar area on Sunday. However, the victim, identified as Pradeep Singh Sandhu, is now stable, police said. Sandhu was walking near the Hari Nagar Clock Tower when four unidentified men allegedly tried to snatch his bracelet and gold chain, police added.

375.title: Sidhu taken to hospital for check-up 3 days after being lodged in jail
375.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu was taken to Rajindra Hospital in Patiala for a medical check-up on Monday, three days after he was lodged in jail. Earlier on May 21, Sidhu's lawyer had claimed that the former Punjab Congress chief was refusing prison food as he's allergic to wheat. Sidhu is undergoing one-year imprisonment in the 1988 road rage case.

376.title: Expectation of a rate hike is a no-brainer: RBI Guv on upcoming repo rate hikes
376.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das in an interview revealed that the central bank wants to increase repo rates in the next few meetings and that the "expectation of a rate hike is a no-brainer". He said, "By how much, I won't be able to tell now but to say that (it will be hiked) to 5.15% now will not be accurate."

377.title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air shares pics of its 1st aircraft, says 'Can't keep calm!'
377.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air on Monday tweeted pictures of its first aircraft. Sharing a picture of the aircraft, it wrote, "Can't keep calm! Say hi to our QP-pie!" While sharing another picture it wrote, "Coming soon to your sky". Akasa Air, which plans to start flight operations in July, had said that its airline code will be 'QP'.

378.title: 22-yr-old techie dies at illegal rave party in Chennai
378.article_body: A 22-year-old IT professional, identified as S Praveen, died at an illegal rave party held at a mall in Chennai's Anna Nagar area. The reason for the deceased's death is suspected to be consumption of excess alcohol, police said. Also, the rave party was being held without the mandatory licence, police added. Notably, three people have been arrested.

379.title: Got message saying 'Salman loved it': Stylist on making Race 3 jacket in 8 hrs
379.article_body: Designer Jishad Shamsudeen said that he made the jacket that actor Salman Khan wore in a 'Race 3' song in eight hours. He further said that he did not know it was being made for Salman Khan and got to know when he delivered the completed jacket. "Following day...I received a message saying, 'Salman loved the jacket'," Jishad added.

380.title: Umran wins award for fastest delivery in all of SRH's IPL 2022 matches, earns ₹14 lakh
380.article_body: SRH fast bowler Umran Malik won the 'Fastest Delivery of the Match' award in each of SRH's 14 matches in IPL 2022. The 22-year-old won a total cash prize of ₹14 lakh. His fastest delivery in IPL 2022 had come against DC, when he clocked 157 kmph. He took 22 wickets in the tournament.

381.title: 900 workers recreated Ajmer & Kannauj, real marble was used: Prithviraj maker
381.article_body: Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi, director of Akshay Kumar starrer 'Prithviraj', has revealed that producer Aditya Chopra recreated 12th century Delhi, Ajmer and Kannauj from scratch. "Real marble was used...900 workers toiled hard for about eight months to build this gigantic set that was a marvel for our eyes," he added. Aditya reportedly spent ₹25 crore to recreate Delhi, Ajmer and Kannauj.

382.title: SL's Kusal Mendis walks off the field holding his chest during B'desh Test, hospitalised
382.article_body: Sri Lanka's Kusal Mendis was taken off the field after he suffered chest pain while fielding in the slip cordon during the opening day of the second Test against Bangladesh in Dhaka. Kusal has been hospitalised as part of a precautionary check-up. As per a doctor, Kusal was suffering from dehydration leading into the match.

383.title: Chris Pratt, Katherine announce birth of second daughter, name her Eloise
383.article_body: Actor Chris Pratt and Katherine Schwarzenegger have welcomed their second child, a baby girl. Pratt took to his social media handles to share the news, writing, "We're so excited to announce the birth of our second daughter, Eloise Christina Schwarzenegger Pratt. Mama and baby are doing well." The couple welcomed their first daughter, Lyla Maria Schwarzenegger Pratt, in August 2020.

384.title: IMD lists expected impact of thunderstorm in Delhi & nearby areas, suggests action
384.article_body: The India Meteorological Department took to Twitter to share list of expected impact due to thunderstorm, duststorm, lightning and rainfall in Delhi and its surrounding areas. In its tweet, IMD said that damage to vulnerable structures, kutcha houses/walls, traffic disruption and reduction in visibility are expected. IMD also suggested people to stay indoors and get out of water bodies.

385.title: Landlord rapes 20-yr-old woman at gunpoint in Bengaluru; arrested
385.article_body: A 46-year-old landlord was arrested on Sunday for allegedly raping his 20-year-old female tenant at gunpoint in Bengaluru. The incident had occurred in April when the accused barged into the woman's house and threatened her with his gun, police said. The police added that according to the complaint, the accused used to harass the woman over friends visiting her house.

386.title: US' Indo-Pacific strategy bound to fail: China ahead of Quad summit
386.article_body: Ahead of the Quad summit in Japan, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Sunday said that the US-led Indo-Pacific strategy is bound to "fail". He claimed that the strategy aims to "contain China" and make Asia-Pacific countries "pawns" for the US. "Facts will prove that the...[strategy is to] create division, incite confrontation and undermine peace," he also claimed.

387.title: Video shows man falling from 30 feet while climbing Karnataka dam; case filed
387.article_body: A young man has been hospitalised in Bengaluru after he fell to the ground from a height of 30 feet while trying to scale the wall of Srinivasa Sagara dam in Karnataka's Chikkaballapur. A video showed him climbing the wall of the dam, however, after scaling the wall halfway, he lost balance and fell. Police registered a case against him.

388.title: Girl reported to be kidnapped on train found with lover at Vadodara station
388.article_body: Police found a girl with her lover at the Vadodara railway station soon after they received information that the girl, travelling on the Avantika Express train, had been "kidnapped". "Following a probe, it was found that the girl was with a [man]...During interrogation, it was revealed that both were in love but the [man] was married," a police official said.

389.title: Gurugram issues work-from-home advisory for private offices due to heavy rain
389.article_body: After Chandigarh weather department’s forecast of rainfall and thunderstorm today, the Gurugram administration has issued a work-from-home advisory for corporate offices. “Private institutions/corporate offices are advised to guide their employees to work from home for today...so that traffic congestion on road can be avoided and repair renovation work...can be done smoothly,” the advisory read.

390.title: Oil prices at $110/barrel pose bigger threat than inflation: Hardeep Singh Puri
390.article_body: Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has said that oil prices staying at $110/barrel could pose bigger threats than inflation to the global economy. Speaking at Davos, the minister said, "If oil prices remain at $110/barrel you are not just talking about inflation, then you're talking about bigger threats. You know, that's where the R (recession) word comes in."

391.title: Which players took the most wickets for their teams in league stage of IPL 2022?
391.article_body: RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal finished as the highest wicket-taker in league stage of IPL 2022 with 26 wickets. T20 World Cup 2021's highest wicket-taker Wanindu Hasaranga took 24 wickets for RCB. PBKS' Kagiso Rabada was the highest wicket-taker among pacers in league stage with 23 wickets. SRH fast bowler Umran Malik took most wickets for his team with 22 scalps.

392.title: Who top-scored for their teams in league stage of IPL 2022?
392.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler ended the IPL 2022 league stage as the highest run-getter, with 629 runs. LSG captain KL Rahul top-scored for his franchise with 537 runs, while Shikhar Dhawan top-scored for PBKS with 460 runs. RCB captain Faf du Plessis top-scored for his team with 443 runs. Uncapped all-rounder Abhishek Sharma top-scored for SRH with 426 runs.

393.title: World's 10 richest men own more wealth than bottom 40% of humanity: Oxfam
393.article_body: The world’s ten richest men own more wealth than the bottom 40% of humanity, 3.1 billion people, revealed Oxfam International in its latest research. According to Oxfam estimates, it would take 112 years for an average person in the bottom 50% to make equivalent to what a person in the top 1% makes in a year.

394.title: 19-yr-old Carlos Alcaraz wins 1st round at French Open, defeats Juan Londero
394.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz won his first round at the French Open by defeating Argentina's Juan Ignacio Londero by 6-4, 6-2 and 6-0 on Sunday. The world number 6 tennis player will now meet his fellow countrymate Albert Ramos-Vinolas in the second round on Wednesday. Notably, Alcaraz has already won four titles in the ongoing tennis season.

395.title: Pakistani singer Abrar accuses Karan Johar of stealing his song, threatens legal action
395.article_body: Pakistani singer Abrar Ul Haq accused Karan Johar of stealing his song 'Nach Punjaban' for his production 'Jugjugg Jeeyo'. "I haven't sold my song...to any Indian movie and reserve the rights to go to court to claim damages. Producers like Johar shouldn't use [copied] songs. This is my 6th song being copied which won't be allowed at all...@DharmaMovies," he tweeted.

396.title: What he does I have only seen Zaheer, Nehra do it: Sehwag on Arshdeep
396.article_body: Talking about PBKS fast bowler Arshdeep Singh, who received his maiden Team India call-up for the T20I series against South Africa, Virender Sehwag said, "He's the bowler who bowls one over with the new ball and two in the slog overs." "I have only seen Zaheer Khan and Ashish Nehra do that during my time," he added.

397.title: China 'flirting with danger', US will defend Taiwan if it's invaded: US Prez Biden
397.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that the US would defend Taiwan militarily if China invaded the self-ruled island, warning that China was "flirting with danger". "That's the commitment we made," he said, adding, "We agreed with the One China policy, we signed on to it...but the idea that it can be taken by force is just not appropriate."

398.title: 16-year-old Jharkhand boy seen kicking girl in school uniform on camera arrested
398.article_body: A 16-year-old boy, who was seen kicking a girl in a school uniform in a video that went viral on social media, has been arrested. Police said that the boy is being sent to a remand home and an investigation into the matter is underway. Police also said that the matter is being said to be a love affair.

399.title: PM Modi pens op-ed on India-Japan relations, writes 'The best is yet to come'
399.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, who is in Japan for two days, has penned an op-ed in a leading Japanese daily. He wrote, "We've traversed a long distance since we established diplomatic relations in 1952. In my view...the best is yet to come." PM Modi also added that India and Japan will contribute towards building an open, free and inclusive Indo-Pacific region.

400.title: Auto stocks trade higher after Centre cuts excise duty on fuel; Maruti up by 4%
400.article_body: Shares of automobile companies traded higher during intraday trade on Monday after the central government announced a cut in excise duty on petrol and diesel. While the BSE Auto Index rose by 2.2%, shares of Ashok Leyland jumped by 5%, Maruti Suzuki India rose 4%, Mahindra and Mahindra climbed 3% and Tata Motors Ltd was up by 1.5%.

401.title: Gurugram civic body renames Vatika Chowk to Shaheed Udham Singh Chowk
401.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram has officially renamed the city's Vatika Chowk, located on Sohna Road, to Shaheed Udham Singh Chowk. The decision to rename was taken in December last year by the MCG's five-member road naming and renaming committee (RNRC). Notably, Vatika Chowk was named after an early 2000s real estate project which took place nearby the junction.

402.title: 19-yr-old held in Ahmedabad's Vejalpur with drugs worth ₹7 lakh
402.article_body: A 19-year-old man was arrested by the Ahmedabad Police's Detection of Crime Branch (DCB) unit for the possession of Mephedrone (MD) drugs worth ₹7 lakh in Vejalpur on Sunday. "He told us that he is himself a drug addict...He makes small zipper pouches of one gram MD and sells them for ₹2,000-2,500 each," an official said.
